column2: British PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17389505" id="Pl-23" latLong="54.000°N 4.000°W" type="COUNTRY",England PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17404382" id="Pl-24" latLong="53.000°N 2.000°W" state="GB-ENG" type="CIVIL",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-14" type="COUNTRY"

column1: We hate any state in war here.
GEISSLER What do you think about Saddam's regime?
UNIDENTIFIED MALE Saddam's very good man.
GEISSLER As the supplies ran out the mood swung from frantic to ugly.
Delivery drivers were threatened.
One of the buses in our convoy was held up at knifepoint.
The troops have moved into Safwan . We, as a consequence, have had to move out.
column2: Safwan PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16889775" id="Pl-21" latLong="30.113°N 47.719°E" state="IQ-BA" type="PPL"

column1: It's simply too dangerous.
This is a clear indication that despite the coalition reassurances that this part of Iraq is safe and despite the aid being brought into the people here, it is still a very, very volatile area.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-13" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="S" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Tonight here the strong are eating.
The weak still go hungry.

Martin Geissler, ITV News, Safwan southern Iraq . (END VIDEOTAPE) WOODRUFF So many different pictures we are getting from across that country . Well, they are making their voices heard at home and abroad.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-13" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="S" type="COUNTRY",country PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-1" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Safwan PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16889775" id="Pl-21" latLong="30.113°N 47.719°E" state="IQ-BA" type="PPL"

column1: When we return, Americans this weekend are marching against the war and in support of the troops.
column2: American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-37" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: We'll check out some of the demonstrations.
Here in the United States this weekend just as they did last weekend, anti-war protesters taking to the street.
column2: United States PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-25" type="COUNTRY"

column1: In Los Angeles , the International Black Coalition for Peace and Justice is sponsoring a rally for peace today.
column2: Los Angeles PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:1663328" id="Pl-26" latLong="34.052°N 118.243°W" state="US-CA" type="PPL"

column1: Congresswoman Maxine Waters was among those scheduled to attend.
In the meantime further north in California , San Francisco is the setting today for a rally aimed at boosting the moral of the American troops in the Persian Gulf region.
column2: American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-37" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",California PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:1780778" id="Pl-27" latLong="37.250°N 119.750°W" mod="N" state="US-CA" type="CIVIL",San Francisco PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:278593" id="Pl-31" latLong="37.775°N 122.418°W" state="US-CA" type="PPL"

column1: CNN's Rusty Dornin is with us from San Francisco . Rusty, what sort of crowd is showing up there?
column2: San Francisco PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:278593" id="Pl-31" latLong="37.775°N 122.418°W" state="US-CA" type="PPL"

column1: RUSTY DORNIN, CNN CORRESPONDENT Well Judy, this is the largest group really we've seen of the support the troops rallies that have been over the last few weeks.
Of course this is the home of the anti- war demonstrations stemming back to the Vietnam War but there are close to between 500 and 1,000 people.
column2: Vietnam PLACE country="VN" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16266660" id="Pl-35" latLong="16.167°N 107.833°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: I'm getting various estimates on the crowd.
We did want to show you an interesting thing here.
Some folks are showing some solidarity with the speakers here.
You're looking at some of San Francisco 's police department's officers.
column2: San Francisco PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:278593" id="Pl-31" latLong="37.775°N 122.418°W" state="US-CA" type="PPL"

column1: I did ask them why they did that.
They said they were wearing skullcaps so they decided to adopt this to show solidarity.
They said the department has not made any statement about whether they think that's all right or not.
This has been a very peaceful demonstration.
As I said, the officers did tell me that this is the largest pro-troops demonstration that has ever been in San Francisco since the Vietnam War.
column2: Vietnam PLACE country="VN" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16266660" id="Pl-35" latLong="16.167°N 107.833°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",San Francisco PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:278593" id="Pl-31" latLong="37.775°N 122.418°W" state="US-CA" type="PPL"

column1: So far, very peaceful.
As I said, there have been a few verbal exchanges but one of the most enthusiastically received speakers here was Bessam Al-Husaini, an Iraqi American.
column2: American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-37" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-13" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="S" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-7" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: He's with the Iraqi American Council.
column2: American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-37" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-13" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="S" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-7" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: How do you feel about supporting the troops?
How does the Iraqi American Council feel?
column2: American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-37" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-13" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="S" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-7" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: BESSAM AL-HUSAINI, IRAQI AMERICAN COUNCIL Well the Iraqi American have been waiting for this liberation and they want to get rid of Saddam so bad and they will have to take it the way it's been offered to us.
column2: AMERICAN PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-38" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",IRAQI PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-4" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-37" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-13" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="S" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-7" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: DORNIN How do you feel though seeing pictures of civilians injured in the bombings?

AL-HUSAINI We get reports that these civilians especially in the (INAUDIBLE) population have been attacked by the Iraqi regime themselves so they can't blame the American and said look what the American doing to us.
column2: American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-37" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-13" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="S" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-7" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: He would love to see this and would draw on this emotion from the Arab world and the European country.
column2: country PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-1" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: DORNIN Now you said you did talk to your family in Baghdad as well and they also are somewhat suspicious of the Americans.
column2: American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-37" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-15" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: AL-HUSAINI Well, I mean the Iraqi people have been the primary victim from the whole thing.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-13" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="S" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-7" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Yeah my family, you know, still in fear.
You know they stay in one room .
They boarded all the - all the windows and they built with a brick one of the windows facing the street .
I mean yes, you know, my prayer to them but we can only do so much.
Hopefully it will be a short war.
It will be attack the Iraqi regime.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-13" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="S" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-7" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: We can live in liberty and freedom soon.
DORNIN Now I understand some of the people here have been threatened by anti-war protesters.
Have you had anyone either threatening you or ... AL-HUSAINI No, no problem.
This has been a very peaceful demonstration.
DORNIN OK.
Thank you very much.
AL-HUSAINI Thank you.
DORNIN Bessam Al-Husaini here and it has been a very peaceful demonstration.
It is wrapping up this afternoon and it looks like the civil disobedience acts by the anti-protesters are scheduled to get underway once again next week.
Judy ...
New Explosions in Mosul  , Baghdad
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-9" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC",Mosul PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897344" id="Pl-10" latLong="36.335°N 43.119°E" state="NI" type="PPLA"

column1: It was in northern Iraq today that an eight artillery round hit the site occupied by Kurdish fighters near Chamchamal .
column2: Kurdish PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:208909932" id="Pl-12" type="RGN",Chamchamal PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16895613" id="Pl-16" latLong="35.537°N 44.832°E" state="SW" type="PPL",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="N" type="COUNTRY"

column1: It happened near an area abandoned earlier by Iraqi forces.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="N" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-7" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: CNN's Kevin Sites is in northern Iraq . (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) KEVIN SITES, CNN CORRESPONDENT This is the road to Kirkuk .
column2: Kirkuk PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16892885" id="Pl-18" latLong="35.468°N 44.392°E" state="TS" type="PPLA",road PLACE country="IQ" id="Pl-19" type="ROAD",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="N" type="COUNTRY"

column1: A day ago it was controlled by Iraqi troops and packed with these land mines but now we can drive far enough to see the outskirts of Kirkuk .
column2: Kirkuk PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16892885" id="Pl-18" latLong="35.468°N 44.392°E" state="TS" type="PPLA",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="N" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-7" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: That's because coalition fighter jets pummeled this Iraqi position on the hills above Chamchamal and Iraqi troops made a hasty retreat.
column2: hills PLACE country="IQ" id="Pl-20" type="MTS",Chamchamal PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16895613" id="Pl-16" latLong="35.537°N 44.832°E" state="SW" type="PPL",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="N" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-7" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: This is what the hilltop looks like now, craters 15 feet deep, busted bunkers and twisted metal, scattered ammunitions and tattered clothing, a helmet, a tube of toothpaste.
column2: hilltop PLACE country="IQ" id="Pl-21" type="MTN"

column1: Kurdish Peshmerga fighters took their place.
column2: Kurdish PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:208909932" id="Pl-12" type="RGN"

column1: I'm glad to see them go this one says.
They killed a lot of our people in Chamchamal but I feel bad for them too.
column2: Chamchamal PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16895613" id="Pl-16" latLong="35.537°N 44.832°E" state="SW" type="PPL"

column1: Some of them were only conscripts.
Some Kurds took advantage of the Iraqi retreat right away.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="N" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-7" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: This one took a bulldozer to a concrete portrait of Saddam Hussein.
It took about 20 minutes but finally it came toppling down.
He says after finishing the job he hopes Saddam Hussein himself will fall too but despite the exuberance of Kurds in the area, it's clear it's much too early to celebrate.
Although the Iraqis retreated from this area, at dusk they fired what observers say were seven artillery rounds back at their former stronghold creating new fear and potentially new casualties.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="N" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-7" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Kevin Sites, CNN Chamchamal northern Iraq . (END VIDEOTAPE) WOODRUFF All right and when we return, waiting here on the home front, a very special reunion between a Marine and his wife.
column2: Chamchamal PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16895613" id="Pl-16" latLong="35.537°N 44.832°E" state="SW" type="PPL",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="N" type="COUNTRY"

column1: There is no greater gap probably than that between the troops overseas and their loved ones here at home.
CNN helped bridge that cassum (ph) at least temporarily between Sergeant Craig Martin of the 15th Marine Expeditionary Unit and his wife Kaycee Martin in California .
column2: California PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:1780778" id="Pl-22" latLong="37.250°N 119.750°W" state="CA" type="CIVIL"

column1: They talked by videophone this morning.
(BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) ANDERSON COOPER, CNN ANCHOR You're eight months pregnant I believe.
How has this been for you?
KAYCEE MARTIN, WIFE OF SOLDIER It's been difficult.
It's hard without him.
I'm doing OK but it would be much better if he was home with me.
COOPER If I could just ask, I mean and you know I don't want to pry so anytime I ask something you don't want to say just tell me to shut up but what is it like for you watching all this coverage?
I mean watching, you know, the access.
The pictures were seeing are really historic in what we are able to see.
Is it more - does it make it more difficult?
Does it make it easier?
K. MARTIN It's very difficult.
It's hard.
The whole time though you're just sitting there trying to catch a glimpse just to see if maybe one of the people on TV is him but you know he tells me don't watch, don't watch.
You know, it's going to be difficult but like I said, it's just too hard.
I want to be able to see just to make sure that he's OK, just catch a glimpse of him.
COOPER How does he look to you right now?
K. MARTIN He looks all right, but dirty.
SGT. CRAIG MARTIN, 15TH MARINE EXPEDITIONARY UNIT I lost my tooth.
K. MARTIN Beautiful.
Thanks.
Thanks for showing me.
COOPER How'd you - how'd you lose your tooth?
C. MARTIN Sorry.
COOPER Can I ask?
How did you lose your tooth?
C. MARTIN When we came across the bridge, the enemy launched some 155 artillery rounds at us.
It came pretty close and the concussion knocked my tooth out.
K. MARTIN Great.
C. MARTIN Yes.
K. MARTIN It doesn't sound like you're being too careful.
C. MARTIN It was fun though.
We're all right.
COOPER Sergeant Martin I don't know if you see, your wife's sort of shaking her head.
C. MARTIN Careful as I can be.
It's all good.
COOPER Sergeant Martin, is there anything else ... C. MARTIN I love you.
COOPER Is there anything else you would like to say either to your wife or to all the people who are watching this?
I know this awkward, you know, doing this on TV and I hate to put you in this position but feel free.
C. MARTIN Yeah.
I've got a couple of things real quick.
To my old man, this is not a distraction.
To my wife, we'll be home soon and I love you.
That's all I've got to say.
COOPER Well that says a lot.
Kaycee, anything else you want to say?
K. MARTIN I love you very much.
I miss you very much.
Everyone is praying for you and I just want you to come home safe and soon so you could see our new baby.
C. MARTIN One more thing, you look really beautiful right now. K. MARTIN Thanks.
I'd like to say the same to you.
C. MARTIN That's stylish.
Don't worry.
We'll take it home.
K. MARTIN Well, just come home soon.
C. MARTIN Without a doubt.
K. MARTIN --- Well, just come home soon.
C. MARTIN I'll try baby.
(END VIDEOTAPE) WOODRUFF A little embarrassing for us to watch.
It's got to be difficult talking to your loved one in front of thousands and thousands of people on television, millions.
Well, in addition to the baby on the way, the Martins also have a three-year-old daughter.
And that is it for this hour.
I'm Judy Woodruff in Washington .
column2: Washington PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:532871" id="Pl-23" latLong="38.895°N 77.037°W" state="DC" type="PPLC"

column1: Wolf Blitzer's report starts right now.
War in Iraq
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-1" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: WALTER RODGERS, CNN SR. INTERNATIONAL CORRESPONDENT (voice-over) The situation here appears to be increasingly tense.
A few moments ago, out on the horizon, not very far ahead of the U.S. Army's 3rd Squadron, 7th Cavalry, we heard more than a few explosions.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-6" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: The U.S. Army's 3rd Squadron, 7th Cavalry has compiled a rather extraordinary record in the past several days.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-6" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: It was the first unit to cross the Euphrates River and then punch SIGNAL id="S-1" northward SIGNAL to SIGNAL id="S-2" within 60 miles SIGNAL of Baghdad .
column2: Euphrates River PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19251239" id="Pl-9" latLong="33.083°N 43.483°E" type="WATER",Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: It was the Army which assigned me to the 3rd Squadron, 7th Cavalry, and that was extremely fortuitous.
It was like sitting in a poker game and drawing four aces, because this is a crack unit.
It's the tip of the tip of the spear.
We've had an absolutely terrific story, pushing forward SIGNAL id="S-3" north SIGNAL toward Baghdad .
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: Seventy-two hours of that was under constant fire coming at us from both sides of the road . UNIDENTIFIED MALE We just heard an incoming -- what the hell!
UNIDENTIFIED MALE No, no, I don't know what it is.
RODGERS Recall Winston Churchill's old quote, "There's nothing so exhilarating as being shot at and missed."
What you try to do is stay calm and continue your broadcasting.
The worst thing you can do, either as a soldier or as a war correspondent is panic.
We're hearing incoming.
We're not sure what it is.
We see some stuff in the sky.
We may have to break this off.
I think we're going to break off this live shot for the time being.
We're not sure what we see up there.
Goodbye.
We've got to dive for vehicles, we think.
See you.
Bye.
We have under heavy fire for the past couple of miles.

Mostly small arms fire, but the sand storm has enabled the Iraqis to come very close to the road , and if I sound a little nervous, it's because we're in the soft skin vehicle and everybody else is in armor.
column2: Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-2" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: We'd like to now show you what we call Old Betsy (ph), a re-used, secondhand U.S. Army Humvee that we've been traveling with.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-6" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Any bullet will pass through it, even a .22 caliber bullet.
You can see our body armor draped on the door.
This is what we've literally been living in.
This is the kitchen, when we're down, and we're very fortunate, because we've got a teapot.
That's my cubby hole.
It's extraordinary cramped, because (UNINTELLIGIBLE) sandbag the floor, in case we hit a mine.
That's all the space I have to eat and sleep in.
You don't sleep.
You really don't sleep out here.
Of course, you're on an adrenaline high, but racing across the desert, you know that you're traveling toward the jaws of what could be a major military battle.
You have to realize, they've been riding along, bouncing along in these tanks for probably six or more hours now.
And if you ride inside that tank, it is like riding in the bowels of a dragon.
They roar, they screech.
The hardest part of the trip is personal discomfort.
We cannot tell you the levels of personal discomfort we've experienced.
The extraordinary sandstorms, the bitter cold nights.
The most uncomfortable thing is having to sleep sitting up in a Humvee with sandbags under your feet, your knees at your chin.
That's excruciatingly uncomfortable, not something that you would wish on anybody but a contortionist.
Let me give you an example of what the dust like.
Look at this.
We have been through days of dust like that.
The U.S. Army's 7th Cavalry has just taken three Iraqi prisoners of war.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-6" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-2" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Actually, they're very close, that is to say, no more than 40 yards away, but the dust and sand are blowing so badly you're getting these vague images.
It's like being in a blizzard, except unfortunately, the sand doesn't melt as the snow does.
What we eat is what the Army calls MREs, meals ready to eat.
And I must say, they're pretty darn good.
And of course, everybody fights for the best ones.
The treats are things like the M&Ms and the breakfast toasties.
The Army is eating much, much better than the grandfathers of these soldiers did and the great grandfathers of these soldiers in the Second World War.
Let me hold the camera and show you my crew.
On camera left is Charlie Miller (ph), he's been our superb and intrepid cameraman.
On my right is Jeff Barweis (ph), a brilliant satellite engineer.
That's the crew which really brings you these pictures.
The pictures you're seeing are absolutely phenomenal.
These are live pictures of the 7th Cavalry racing across the desert.
You've never seen battlefield pictures like these before.
What you're watching here is truly historic television and journalism.
(END VIDEOTAPE) CROWLEY Walter Rodgers with the 3-7th.
Just ahead we'll have the latest on today's suicide bombing in Israel .
column2: Israel PLACE country="IL" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19219725" id="Pl-10" latLong="31.500°N 34.750°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: A report from CNN's Kelly Wallace when we return.
War in Iraq
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-1" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: We will be back later on the war in Iraq .
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-6" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: But first, we want to go somewhere else in the region to tell you that dozens were injured today in the first suicide bombing in Israel in three weeks.
column2: Israel PLACE country="IL" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19219725" id="Pl-16" latLong="31.500°N 34.750°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: CNN's Kelly Wallace reports on today's attack in Netanya . (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) KELLY WALLACE, CNN CORRESPONDENT (on camera) It had been very quiet inside Israel since the start of the U.s. -led war against Iraq .
column2: Israel PLACE country="IL" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19219725" id="Pl-16" latLong="31.500°N 34.750°E" type="COUNTRY",Netanya PLACE country="IL" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19219140" id="Pl-18" latLong="32.334°N 34.858°E" state="IL-M" type="PPL",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-6" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",U.s. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-7" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Many Israelis were fearing that quiet would come to an end.
column2: Israel PLACE country="IL" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19219725" id="Pl-16" latLong="31.500°N 34.750°E" type="COUNTRY",Israeli PLACE country="IL" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19219725" id="Pl-13" latLong="31.500°N 34.750°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: And it did on this day.
Police say a suicide bomber blew himself up outside this cafe , called The London Cafe , earlier Sunday afternoon.
column2: London PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17398111" id="Pl-20" latLong="51.500°N 0.117°W" predicative="true" state="GB-ENG" type="PPLC",cafe PLACE country="IL" form="NOM" id="Pl-282" type="FAC",Cafe PLACE country="IL" form="NAM" id="Pl-289" type="FAC"

column1: We can show you some pictures from earlier Sunday.
People here tell us the cafe was filled with people enjoying the spring weather.
column2: cafe PLACE country="IL" form="NOM" id="Pl-282" type="FAC"

column1: Many here though say they are relieved only one person dead, the suicide bomber.
Dozens, though, injured, including some Israeli soldiers, because according to an eyewitness, he said many soldiers were here also enjoying the spring weather.
column2: Israel PLACE country="IL" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19219725" id="Pl-16" latLong="31.500°N 34.750°E" type="COUNTRY",Israeli PLACE country="IL" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19219725" id="Pl-13" latLong="31.500°N 34.750°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: UNIDENTIFIED MALE Then it was big bomb.
And many soldier.
Two soldiers were down here.
Many blood.
Many people skip from here.
Big paranoia.

WALLACE There had been many terrorist attacks here in Netanya , including the deadliest suicide bombing ever in Israel almost exactly a year ago, March 27, at the Park Hotel during Passover, 29 people killed in that attack.
column2: Park Hotel PLACE country="IL" form="NAM" id="Pl-288" type="FAC",Israel PLACE country="IL" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19219725" id="Pl-16" latLong="31.500°N 34.750°E" type="COUNTRY",Netanya PLACE country="IL" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19219140" id="Pl-18" latLong="32.334°N 34.858°E" state="IL-M" type="PPL"

column1: As for this attack, the Palestinian militant group Islamic Jihad is claiming responsibility.
column2: Palestinian PLACE country="PS" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:208674239" id="Pl-21" predicative="true" type="RGN"

column1: According to a leaflet from the group obtained by CNN, the group says the attack was to show the union of Palestinians with the people of Iraq .
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-6" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Palestinian PLACE country="PS" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:208674239" id="Pl-21" predicative="true" type="RGN"

column1: The group is also claiming that Islamic Jihad militants are already inside Iraq to carry out attacks against U.S. and British forces.
column2: British PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17389505" id="Pl-22" latLong="54.000°N 4.000°W" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-6" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-10" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Israel has been on a heightened state of alert since the start of the U.S. -led war against Iraq .
column2: Israel PLACE country="IL" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19219725" id="Pl-16" latLong="31.500°N 34.750°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-6" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-10" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: And now many Israelis fear they could see more attacks like the one they saw here today as the military campaign against Saddam Hussein continues.
column2: Israel PLACE country="IL" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19219725" id="Pl-16" latLong="31.500°N 34.750°E" type="COUNTRY",Israeli PLACE country="IL" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19219725" id="Pl-13" latLong="31.500°N 34.750°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: I'm Kelly Wallace, CNN, reporting from Netanyahu , Israel . (END VIDEOTAPE) CROWLEY A baseball legend rallies the troops.
column2: Israel PLACE country="IL" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19219725" id="Pl-16" latLong="31.500°N 34.750°E" type="COUNTRY",Netanya PLACE country="IL" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19219140" id="Pl-18" latLong="32.334°N 34.858°E" state="IL-M" type="PPL",Netanyahu PLACE country="IL" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19219140" id="Pl-19" latLong="32.334°N 34.858°E" state="IL-M" type="PPL"

column1: Up next, pitching great Roger Clemens talks about his experiences meeting U.S. service members in Afghanistan and the Persian Gulf .
column2: Afghanistan PLACE country="AF" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16632074" id="Pl-23" latLong="33.000°N 65.000°E" type="COUNTRY",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-10" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Push to Baghdad  Begins; POW Safe in Army's Care
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-32" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: Hi, Judy.
Thank you very much.
As of an hour or so ago, we got word from the battlefield that U.S. forces were SIGNAL id="S-1" just 15 miles SIGNAL away from the southern edge of Baghdad .
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-18" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-31" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: And they may be even closer right now.
The toughest fight, though, may lie ahead in the heart of the Iraqi capital . Pentagon sources say the first phase of the final push into Baghdad is now under way.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-31" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",capital PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-21" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" mod="S" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: U.S. -led forces were able to press farther north after defeating Iraqi Republican Guard units at Karbala and Kut (ph).
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-18" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Karbala PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16892923" id="Pl-37" latLong="32.250°N 43.117°E" state="IQ-KA" type="PPLA",Kut PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897407" id="Pl-38" latLong="32.498°N 45.829°E" state="IQ-WA" type="PPLA",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Our embedded reporters say the two-pronged advance appears to be moving faster than commanders expected.
The Pentagon says two of the Republican Guard divisions defending Baghdad are no longer credible forces.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-31" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: Scenes from Najaf may also be bolstering the troops' spirit.
column2: Najaf PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897127" id="Pl-40" latLong="31.992°N 44.351°E" state="IQ-NA" type="PPLA"

column1: Iraqis who initially were cautious when U.S. forces arrived in Najaf ended cheering them on, shaking their hands and patting their backs.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-18" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Najaf PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897127" id="Pl-40" latLong="31.992°N 44.351°E" state="IQ-NA" type="PPLA",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: U.S. Army's 7th Cavalry is in the forefront of U.S. troops since they first left Kuwait and crossed directly into the Iraqi desert.
column2: desert PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-42" type="RGN",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-18" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Kuwait PLACE country="KW" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19210228" id="Pl-41" latLong="29.500°N 47.750°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Our Walter Rodgers is embedded with the unit's 3rd Squadron, which is leading the 3rd Infantry Division's march toward the Iraqi capital . (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) WALTER RODGERS, CNN CORRESPONDENT Throughout the day, as the U.S. Army 7th Cavalry punched SIGNAL id="S-6" northward SIGNAL in the general direction of Baghdad , we have seen huge convoys of supply troops moving ever northward.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-18" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-31" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",capital PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-21" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" mod="S" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Indeed, all the arrows on the Army's map seem to be pointing in the direction of the southern suburbs of Baghdad .
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-31" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: Earlier in the day, the 1st Brigade of the 3rd Infantry Division took Karbala with a minimum of fight.
column2: Karbala PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16892923" id="Pl-37" latLong="32.250°N 43.117°E" state="IQ-KA" type="PPLA"

column1: And then the 3rd Brigade of the 3rd Infantry Division secured the town of Karbala . Additionally, the 7th Cavalry has pushed onward in the general direction of Baghdad .
column2: Karbala PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16892923" id="Pl-37" latLong="32.250°N 43.117°E" state="IQ-KA" type="PPLA",Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-31" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: Yesterday we were SIGNAL id="S-2" about 50 miles SIGNAL from the southern suburbs of Baghdad .
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-31" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: We have perhaps have that distance.
Throughout the day, we have watched the 3rd Infantry Division bring in prisoners of war.
Iraqi soldiers glad the war is over for them, perhaps 100 at a time.
column2: Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: There were times when the 7th Cavalry itself got into some skirmishes as it pushed forward, again in the direction of Baghdad .
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-31" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: There was a bit of a firefight when the 7th Cavalry came upon three Soviet vintage 20- millimeter anti-aircraft guns, ack-ack guns.
The Iraqi unit in possession of those guns fired mortars in the direction of the 7th Cavalry.
column2: Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: The Apache troop opened its tank guns, opened its own mortars, decimated that unit, put it out of existence and probably killed some 20 Iraqis in the process.
column2: Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: This as it continues to push ever closer towards the southern suburbs of Baghdad .
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-31" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: Walter Rodgers, CNN, with the U.S. 7th Cavalry in the Iraqi desert . (END VIDEOTAPE) BLITZER And it's a similar story from CNN's Karl Penhaul who is now SIGNAL id="S-3" just miles SIGNAL from the southern outskirts of the Iraqi capital . He's embedded with the U.S. Army's 11th Attack Helicopter Regiment.
column2: desert PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-42" type="RGN",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-18" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",capital PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-21" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" mod="S" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Here's his report just filed a few minutes ago.
(BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) KARL PENHAUL, CNN CORRESPONDENT (voice-over) The speed as they push to Baghdad seems to have gathered pace overnight and in the course of this morning.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-31" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: In fact, it's going much faster than many of the U.S. commanders on the ground predicted.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-18" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: CAPT. BRIAN MCCORT, PILOT The intensity it's very quick moving, very fluid battle.
The armor, and mechanized infantry, and artillery pieces and personnel on the ground are moving at rapid speeds.

PENHAUL Overnight and early this morning, the tanks and Bradley fighting vehicles of the 3rd Infantry Division backed by the Apache attack helicopters of the 11th Aviation Regiment punched through the Republican Guard defenses in and around Karbala .
column2: Karbala PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16892923" id="Pl-37" latLong="32.250°N 43.117°E" state="IQ-KA" type="PPLA"

column1: They were then able to advance SIGNAL id="S-4" far north SIGNAL of that city and, as we speak, U.S. commanders tell me that elements of the 3rd Infantry Division are now literally just a SIGNAL id="S-5" few miles SIGNAL from Baghdad . (END VIDEOTAPE)
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-18" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-31" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",city PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16892923" id="Pl-43" latLong="32.250°N 43.117°E" state="IQ-KA" type="PPLA"

column1: Push to Baghdad  Begins; POW Safe in Army's Care
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-13" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC"

column1: That's CNN's Karl Penhaul with the very latest from the battlefront.
Let's get an update now on casualties on Operation Iraqi Freedom.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-4" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-6" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Military officials say 39 Americans have been killed in combat, 9 more by friendly fire or an accident.
Britain reports 6 of its troops have been killed by combat, 19 more in nonhostile action and 2 deaths have not been classified.
column2: Britain PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17389505" id="Pl-26" latLong="54.000°N 4.000°W" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Iraq does not report on its military casualties, but Iraqi officials say 420 civilians have been killed and about 4,000 injured.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-4" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-6" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: U.S. Central Command says 4,500 Iraqis have been taken prisoner.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-4" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-6" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-12" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Seven Americans remain prisoners of war in Iraq and 15 Americans are listed as missing in action.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-4" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: One less than yesterday after that dramatic rescue of Private First Class Jessica Lynch.

Judy, in the next hour, on our special "WOLF BLITZER REPORTS," I'm going to be speaking live to her older brother who is in the Army, her younger sister who wants to be in the Army, just around the same time as Jessica is going to be arriving at Ramstein , the air base in Germany for some serious medical treatment.
column2: Ramstein PLACE country="DE" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:20024036" id="Pl-27" latLong="49.433°N 7.600°E" state="RP" type="FAC",Germany PLACE country="DE" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:18224345" id="Pl-28" latLong="51.500°N 10.500°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: That's all coming up on our special edition of "WOLF BLITZER REPORTS" at the top of the hour.
Judy, back to you.
WOODRUFF All right, Wolf, and we will be watching.
Thanks very much.
Well, at the Pentagon briefing this afternoon, officials describing several units of the Republican Guard as effectively no longer being a credible fighting force.
column2: Pentagon PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:1473192" id="Pl-35" latLong="38.871°N 77.056°W" state="VA" type="FAC"

column1: Let's get the very latest from the Pentagon for the overall war picture as they see it.
column2: Pentagon PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:1473192" id="Pl-35" latLong="38.871°N 77.056°W" state="VA" type="FAC"

column1: Our Jamie McIntyre our senior military affairs correspondent is with us now.
Hello, again, Jamie.
JAMIE MCINTYRE, CNN SNR.
MILITARY AFFAIRS CORRESPONDENT Well Judy, the Pentagon is beginning to see positive signs that it hadn't seen for awhile.
column2: Pentagon PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:1473192" id="Pl-35" latLong="38.871°N 77.056°W" state="VA" type="FAC"

column1: First of all, as we saw just a few moments ago on CNN, the pictures of some of the actual happy Iraqi citizens welcoming U.S. troops, that taking place in Najaf .
column2: Najaf PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897127" id="Pl-25" latLong="31.992°N 44.351°E" state="NA" type="PPLA",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-4" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-6" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-12" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Also the Pentagon is seeing lighter than expected resistance indicating at least that they may have really seriously degraded those Republican Guard divisions before the U.S. troops arrived, both in Karbala and also in Al Kut .
column2: Al Kut PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897407" id="Pl-23" latLong="32.498°N 45.829°E" state="WA" type="PPLA",Pentagon PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:1473192" id="Pl-35" latLong="38.871°N 77.056°W" state="VA" type="FAC",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-12" type="COUNTRY",Karbala PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16892923" id="Pl-21" latLong="32.250°N 43.117°E" state="KA" type="PPLA"

column1: They met lighter than expected resistance.

But the Pentagon officials stress that as they close in on Baghdad , this becomes the real dangerous part as they enter that so- called red zone where Saddam Hussein is believed to have given his commanders authority to use chemical weapons, and that use of chemical weapons remains a real fear at the Pentagon . (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP) MAJOR GENERAL STANLEY MCCHRYSTAL, JOINT CHIEFS, VICE DIR.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-19" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC",Pentagon PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:1473192" id="Pl-35" latLong="38.871°N 77.056°W" state="VA" type="FAC"

column1: We are not expecting to drive into Baghdad suddenly and seize it in a coup de mains, or anything like that.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-19" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC"

column1: So, in regard to that, we are paying great attention to their ability to defend on the ground.
They may just suddenly be effective on the ground.
Additionally, their ability to use chemical and biological weapons, they've proven it historically.
We believe they have the capability now.
Clearly, as we threaten the core of the regime, which Baghdad and Tikrit represent, we believe that the likelihood of them using those weapons goes up.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-19" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC",Tikrit PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16888105" id="Pl-37" latLong="34.597°N 43.677°E" state="SD" type="PPL"

column1: (END VIDEO CLIP) BLITZER In less than 24 hours, the U.S. 101st Airborne Division has driven Iraqi Fedayeen fighters from the key city of Najaf , pushed north in a several-pronged attack.
column2: Najaf PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897127" id="Pl-25" latLong="31.992°N 44.351°E" state="NA" type="PPLA",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-4" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-6" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-12" type="COUNTRY"

column1: The Army's 3rd Infantry has punched through Karbala , meeting only light resistance from the Medina Republican Guard, and moving along highway nine within 25 miles of Baghdad .
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-19" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC",Karbala PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16892923" id="Pl-21" latLong="32.250°N 43.117°E" state="KA" type="PPLA"

column1: At the same time, the Marines from the 1st Division have secured a key Tigris River crossing near Al Kut and reported to have essentially destroyed the combat fighting ability of that light infantry Baghdad division that was supposed to be providing defense down there.
column2: Tigris River PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16895173" id="Pl-38" latLong="31.000°N 47.417°E" type="WATER",Al Kut PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897407" id="Pl-23" latLong="32.498°N 45.829°E" state="WA" type="PPLA",Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-19" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC"

column1: At the U.S. Central Command briefing this morning at the forward headquarters in Doha , Qatar , General Vincent Brooks said that the U.S. would be continuing to approach Baghdad .
column2: Qatar PLACE country="QA" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19214483" id="Pl-40" latLong="25.500°N 51.250°E" type="COUNTRY",Doha PLACE country="QA" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19214831" id="Pl-39" latLong="25.287°N 51.533°E" state="DW" type="PPLC",Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-19" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-12" type="COUNTRY"

column1: He said, quote, "The dagger is clearly pointed at the heart of the regime now, and it will remain pointed at it," he said, "until the regime is gone."
Judy.
WOODRUFF Jamie, these descriptions of the weakening of the Republican Guard begin to bring back memories of the first Gulf War 12 years ago.
Is there a chance that coalition forces could, at this point, be overestimating the strength of what's left of the opposition?
MCINTYRE Well, they might be.
And that might be a good thing.
They are taking it very cautiously.
No one, again, they stress the most dangerous part of this could be ahead.
Could be urban combat.
Could involve chemical weapons.
Could be the most loyal fighters left as they draw into Baghdad .
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-19" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC"

column1: Could be a very dangerous time.
They also are careful to point out that even while they say that the division has been destroyed, they don't mean every single person has been killed.
Simply that its combat effectiveness has been eliminated - Judy.
WOODRUFF We notice they said they did not want to use the word destroyed, in fact, they said let others do that.
Jamie McIntyre at the Pentagon .
column2: Pentagon PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:1473192" id="Pl-35" latLong="38.871°N 77.056°W" state="VA" type="FAC"

column1: Push to Baghdad  Begins; POW Safe in Army's Care
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-4" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC"

column1: Well, rescued American prisoner of war Jessica Lynch is expected to arrive at Ramstein air base in Germany just about an hour from now.
column2: American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-2" type="COUNTRY",Germany PLACE country="DE" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:18224345" id="Pl-8" latLong="51.500°N 10.500°E" type="COUNTRY",Ramstein air base PLACE country="DE" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:20024036" id="Pl-6" latLong="49.433°N 7.600°E" state="RP" type="FAC"

column1: CNN will have live coverage of her arrival.
Lynch was rescued in a daring raid by U.S. forces on the Saddam hospital in Nasiriya .
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-3" type="COUNTRY",Nasiriya PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897120" id="Pl-10" latLong="31.054°N 46.259°E" state="DQ" type="PPLA"

column1: This nightscope video shows troops carrying the 19-year-old Army private to a Blackhawk helicopter.
We know, though, that 11 bodies were also recovered in this operation, and military officials say they are working now to identify them.
When she's in Germany , Lynch will be treated for bullet wounds and broken bones.
column2: Germany PLACE country="DE" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:18224345" id="Pl-8" latLong="51.500°N 10.500°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: She's reported to be in stable condition.
She and more than a dozen other members of her Army maintenance unit were ambushed near Nasiriya more than a week ago.
column2: Nasiriya PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897120" id="Pl-10" latLong="31.054°N 46.259°E" state="DQ" type="PPLA"

column1: WOODRUFF Meantime in Palestine , West Virginia , there is a lot of joy over the news of Jessica Lynch's rescue.
column2: Palestine PLACE country="US" form="NAM" id="Pl-11" state="WV" type="PPL",West Virginia PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:1780805" id="Pl-15" latLong="38.500°N 80.500°W" state="WV" type="CIVIL"

column1: Her father, mother and other family members say they never gave up hope, despite their fears of what might have happened.
And they say they are grateful to her rescuers.
(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP) GREG LYNCH, JR, JESSICA LYNCH'S BROTHER I can't really say how the military is functioning over there because I'm not there.
But they are doing a job, you know, I don't know the thoughts of the soldiers, the men and women that went into that building and brought her out.
They are heroes in my book.
(END VIDEO CLIP) WOODRUFF West Virginia 's United States Senator Robert Byrd is also praising the rescue.
column2: United States PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-1" type="COUNTRY",West Virginia PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:1780805" id="Pl-15" latLong="38.500°N 80.500°W" state="WV" type="CIVIL"

column1: (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP) SEN. ROBERT BYRD (D), WEST VIRGINIA She was rescued in a daring effort by the brave Army rangers and Navy SEALS.
column2: WEST VIRGINIA PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:1780805" id="Pl-14" latLong="38.500°N 80.500°W" state="WV" type="CIVIL"

column1: And today she is safe.
Safe.
Safe once again.
Her state of West Virginia is relieved.
column2: West Virginia PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:1780805" id="Pl-15" latLong="38.500°N 80.500°W" state="WV" type="CIVIL"

column1: Her community is exuberant.
Her family is overjoyed.
I spoke with Jessica Lynch's father last evening and shared with him our thoughts and good wishes.
(END VIDEO CLIP) WOODRUFF Senator Byrd called the rescue miraculous.
We'll have more on the march toward Baghdad after a quick break.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-5" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC"

column1: We preview the potential battles ahead and the strategies in play when we check in with our military analyst. (COMMERCIAL BREAK)
Push to Baghdad  Begins; POW Safe in Army's Care
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-10" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: U.S. forces moving ever closer to Baghdad , but military officials say they are not counting on capitulation.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-19" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-6" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: For a look at what might lie ahead for U.S. forces, let's turn to our Miles O'Brien in Atlanta .
column2: Atlanta PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:352615" id="Pl-21" latLong="33.749°N 84.388°W" state="US-GA" type="PPLA",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-6" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: MILES O'BRIEN, CNN ANCHOR Thank you very much, Judy.
To help guide us through all this discussion about red zones, and daggers and exactly what is the strength of the Republican Guard, we turn to Colonel Patrick Lang.
He's retired with the United States Army.
column2: United States PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-9" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: He spent some time in the Defence Intelligence Agency, among other things.
Colonel, good to have you with us.
COL. PAT LANG (RET,), U.S. ARMY You're welcome.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-6" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: O'BRIEN What do you suppose right now would be the governor on the forward advance?
Is it the Republican Guard or is it the U.S. and coalition supply lines?
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-6" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Or both?
LANG Well, they are close enough up to Baghdad now so that the supply line issue is probably not a big one since they had time to restock, food, fuel and ammunition.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-19" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: So, probably the main thing is combing through the rubble that the air force has left of these Republican Guard divisions to make sure there are no strong points that you leave behind, that could threaten your lines of supply once they get past.
Once they are satisfied they are through all that, I would imaging there will be a pause while they start to reconnoiter into Baghdad , probing hard to see how much resistance there really is.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-19" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: O'BRIEN Well, let me ask you that.
First of all, I just wanted to tell viewers where we just took our satellite imagery.
This is that Karbala area which is SIGNAL id="S-1" about 50 miles SIGNAL from Baghdad .
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-19" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",Karbala PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16892923" id="Pl-20" latLong="32.250°N 43.117°E" state="IQ-KA" type="RGN"

column1: Baghdad is roughly in that direction from there.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-19" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: We know the vanguard is supposedly as close as 15 miles.
One of the next key points along the way here is Saddam international airport . Do you suppose that is a key target right now?
column2: Saddam international airport PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" id="Pl-274" type="FAC"

column1: LANG Oh, I'm sure it is.
I mean a feature of that importance would always be something you'd want to hold.

And besides, as soon as you get control of it you'd be able to start using it for air operations, and put a survey team in there as soon as it's secured, and then start using it for helicopter operations, haul forward some big bladders of fuel to refuel helicopters and rearm them and things like that.
And if the front stabilizes between there and the downtown Baghdad , they'll start using it for a fixed wing aircraft as well.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-19" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: O'BRIEN Now, as you go from Saddam International Airport into town you see there are some big, wide divided highways there.
column2: Saddam International Airport PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" id="Pl-285" type="FAC"

column1: Control of these highways will be crucial won't it?
LANG Yeah, these are the high-speed approaches into the heart of the city and armored forces like the 3rd Mechanized Infantry Division just love high-speed approaches.
column2: city PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-28" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: They will try to go down those things, cutting the city up into sectors as best they can, and then work on the specific sectors of the city they think are a key terrain.
column2: city PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-28" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: I would think, probably, various facilities as well as major government buildings that they need to control to set up a new government.
O'BRIEN It's a big city , about the size of Philadelphia or thereabouts.
column2: Philadelphia PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:1210052" id="Pl-29" latLong="39.952°N 75.164°W" state="US-PA" type="PPL",city PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-28" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: Some have said Chicago is a good analogy.
column2: Chicago PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:424587" id="Pl-30" latLong="41.850°N 87.650°W" state="US-IL" type="PPL"

column1: Tremendous amount of force needed to control a city of that source, or am a wrong?
column2: city PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-28" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: LANG Well, it depends on the attitude of the populous, which is not clear yet.
If the population, in fact, or at least a big part of them like the Shia half of the population, if they want to be liberated, then you can control them with a fairly small force.

If, in fact, a lot of people in the city don't want to be liberated and you're never going to know that until you try, then you're going to need a much larger force, and we might end up waiting a couple of weeks for reinforcements.
column2: city PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-28" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: O'BRIEN Based on what you've seen so far, what is your sense of that?
The Shias are a bit gun shy, if you will, in the south because of what happened in 1991.
They rose up, didn't get American support.
column2: American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-7" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Do you suppose it will be a different story in Baghdad ?
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-19" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: Is there a lot of latent hatred for Saddam Hussein that will come out?
LANG Yes, there is, but these folks are going to be mighty cautious.
They have a long history of being kicked around by the Sunni Arab population of central Iraq .
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-2" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: And they don't have any particular reason to trust us, so far.
So they'll wait and see what happens.
It's the other people in the city you have to worry about, who are ethnically much the same as the Saddam Hussein regime.
column2: city PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-28" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: And their behavior right now is unpredictable.
O'BRIEN Colonel Patrick Lang, retired, United states Army, thanks for your insights.
column2: United states PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-8" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: A man who has been to Baghdad many times and can tell us with great knowledge exactly what it's going to be like to fight on those avenues in that sprawling city of Baghdad - Judy.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-19" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",city PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-28" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: WOODRUFF Always helps Miles to hear a voice of experience.
Thank you and thanks to Colonel Lang.
When we come back, hopes rising among investors.
That means stocks were up today on Wall Street as they look at the progress of the war in Iraq .
column2: Wall Street PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:208991647" id="Pl-31" state="US-NY" type="ROAD",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-2" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: We're going to check in with Rhonda Schaffler at the stock exchange in just a moment.
Push to Baghdad  Begins; POW Safe in Army's Care
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-22" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: As coalition forces push ahead in their march toward Baghdad , they have encountered some resistance in the Shiite holy city of Karbala .
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-26" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",Karbala PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:208786850" id="Pl-29" state="IQ-KA" type="PPLA"

column1: But American troops and their superior technology have turned out to be a key factor in the fighting there.
column2: American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-17" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",America PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-18" type="COUNTRY"

column1: And to the south, British forces continue their attack on targets around Basra .
column2: British PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17389505" id="Pl-33" latLong="54.000°N 4.000°W" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Basra PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897821" id="Pl-36" latLong="30.494°N 47.819°E" state="IQ-BA" type="PPLA"

column1: ITN correspondent Tim Ewart reports.
(BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) TIM EWART, ITN CORRESPONDENT These are soldiers of the U.S. 3rd Infantry, fighting near Karbala , SIGNAL id="S-1" southwest SIGNAL of Baghdad .
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-26" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-21" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Karbala PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:208786850" id="Pl-29" state="IQ-KA" type="PPLA"

column1: They are facing Saddam Hussein's Republican Guard, his finest soldiers.
But for all the resistance, coalition aircraft rule the skies and coalition technology is overwhelmingly superior.
U.S. commanders believe the Republican Guard is a doomed force.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-21" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: BRIG. GEN. VINCENT BROOKS, U.S. CENTRAL COMMAND We will approach Baghdad .
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-26" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-21" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: The dagger is clearly pointed at the heart of the regime right now and will remain pointed at it until the regime is gone.
EWART To the south, more black smoke over the town of Basra .
column2: Basra PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897821" id="Pl-36" latLong="30.494°N 47.819°E" state="IQ-BA" type="PPLA",town PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16897821" id="P-320" latLong="30.494°N 47.819°E" state="IQ-BA" type="PPLA"

column1: British troops control the outskirts of the town , and today destroyed another building they said housed Iraqi fighters.
column2: building PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16897821" id="Pl-37" latLong="30.494°N 47.819°E" state="IQ-BA" type="FAC",British PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17389505" id="Pl-33" latLong="54.000°N 4.000°W" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-16" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="N" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-15" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",town PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16897821" id="P-320" latLong="30.494°N 47.819°E" state="IQ-BA" type="PPLA"

column1: There is much fear here of the Saddam loyalists who still hold sway in Basra and of the invading troops waiting at the gates. (on camera): The Americans are racing towards Baghdad , the British still seem anxious to make their progress here as measured as possible.
column2: American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-17" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",British PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17389505" id="Pl-33" latLong="54.000°N 4.000°W" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-26" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",Basra PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897821" id="Pl-36" latLong="30.494°N 47.819°E" state="IQ-BA" type="PPLA",America PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-18" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Basra will fall.
column2: Basra PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897821" id="Pl-36" latLong="30.494°N 47.819°E" state="IQ-BA" type="PPLA"

column1: But there may first be fighting in the capital , SIGNAL id="S-2" 250 miles SIGNAL to the SIGNAL id="S-3" north SIGNAL .
column2: capital PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16892885" id="Pl-48" latLong="35.468°N 44.392°E" state="IQ-TS" type="PPLA"

column1: Tim Ewart, ITV News, southern Iraq . (END VIDEOTAPE) WOODRUFF From the south to the north in the rolling hills of northern Iraq , coalition air strikes targeted Iraqi positions today in what's been called a ferocious bombardment.
column2: hills PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-38" type="MTS",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-16" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="N" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-15" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: It happened outside the oil-rich city of Kirkuk .
column2: Kirkuk PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16892885" id="Pl-44" latLong="35.468°N 44.392°E" state="IQ-TS" type="PPLA"

column1: CNN's Brent Sadler is there.
(BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) BRENT SADLER, CNN CORRESPONDENT A back road leading to Kirkuk , the heartland of northern Iraq 's oil wealth.
column2: Kirkuk PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16892885" id="Pl-44" latLong="35.468°N 44.392°E" state="IQ-TS" type="PPLA",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-16" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="N" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: A road that's now in the hands of Iraqi Kurdish forces.
column2: Kurdish PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:208909932" id="Pl-47" predicative="true" type="RGN",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-16" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="N" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-15" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Occupying these positions, strattled along a crescent-shaped front line east of Kirkuk .
column2: Kirkuk PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16892885" id="Pl-44" latLong="35.468°N 44.392°E" state="IQ-TS" type="PPLA"

column1: This land fell into Iraqi - Kurdish hands without a shot being fired.
column2: Kurdish PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:208909932" id="Pl-47" predicative="true" type="RGN",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-16" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="N" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-15" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Iraqi soldiers fled these positions in a hurry, under the onslaught of coalition bombing.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-16" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="N" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-15" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: This is the end of the road for Kurdish forces manning this remote checkpoint.
column2: Kurdish PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:208909932" id="Pl-47" predicative="true" type="RGN"

column1: But with special permission, they let us through.
We are now between the lines, a no man's land of abandoned Iraqi bunkers and an unnerving silence, broken by the roar of warplanes and the distant surge of air strikes.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-16" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="N" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-15" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: This territory is within easy artillery range of Saddam Hussein's forces and circling Kirkuk .
column2: Kirkuk PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16892885" id="Pl-44" latLong="35.468°N 44.392°E" state="IQ-TS" type="PPLA"

column1: The oil capital of northern Iraq is visible behind me, just over there, a harmless flare of burning gases is easily identifiable.
column2: capital PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16892885" id="Pl-48" latLong="35.468°N 44.392°E" state="IQ-TS" type="PPLA",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-16" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="N" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Iraq 's precious oil field remain intact.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-16" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="N" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Also intact, Kirkuk 's defenses, in the distant haze.
column2: Kirkuk PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16892885" id="Pl-44" latLong="35.468°N 44.392°E" state="IQ-TS" type="PPLA"

column1: Iraq 's armed opposition, including these Kurds, waits on the sidelines to join the fray, if America asks.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-16" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="N" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",America PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-18" type="COUNTRY"

column1: PRIME MINISTER BARHAM SALEH, KURDISTAN REGIONAL GOV.
column2: KURDISTAN PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:208909932" id="Pl-49" predicative="true" type="RGN"

column1: This is about freedom for Iraq .
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-16" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="N" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: This is about the liberation of Iraq , and we Iraqis must shoulder the responsibility of helping in the process of liberation.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-16" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="N" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-15" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: SADLER And, says the Iraqi opposition, in winning this war.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-16" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="N" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-15" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Brent Sadler, CNN, near Kirkuk in northern Iraq . (END VIDEOTAPE)
column2: Kirkuk PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16892885" id="Pl-44" latLong="35.468°N 44.392°E" state="IQ-TS" type="PPLA",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-16" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="N" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Push to Baghdad  Begins; POW Safe in Army's Care
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: WOODRUFF With U.S. forces rolling closer and closer to Baghdad , the military seems to be zeroing in on the ground war.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-11" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: But, as it has from the beginning, air power remains an important part of the battle.
Let's check in with CNN's Gary Tuchman at an air base SIGNAL id="S-3" near SIGNAL Iraq .
column2: base PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-345" type="FAC",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-10" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Gary you've seen it firsthand from the first moments.
GARY TUCHMAN, CNN CORRESPONDENT Well, that's right, Judy.
In two weeks after the air war began, there is no let-up and no effective response from the Iraqis.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-10" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-9" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: According to the Air Force, at any given time, there are more 200 coalition aircraft either over Iraq , flying to Iraq or flying from Iraq .
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-10" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: We come to you from a base SIGNAL id="S-4" near SIGNAL the Iraqi border.
column2: base PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-345" type="FAC",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-10" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-9" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Many pilots are flying these A-10 attack planes behind me.
They also fly F-16s.
There are also Marine FA-18s and Marine Heriers at this base .
column2: base PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-345" type="FAC"

column1: We can tell you that a lot of pilots of this base are not flying to another base in Iraq .
column2: base PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-345" type="FAC",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-10" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: It's a base that was taken over by the coalition last week.
column2: base PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-345" type="FAC"

column1: And we spent part of the day at that base .
column2: base PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-345" type="FAC"

column1: And when you arrive there, you are greeted in a sense by Saddam Hussein.
(BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) TUCHMAN This is Talil , Iraq .
column2: Talil PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" id="Pl-358" type="PPL",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-10" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: The Talil Air Base .
column2: Talil PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" id="Pl-358" type="PPL",Talil Air Base PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" id="Pl-343" type="FAC"

column1: But the are no more Iraqis here, the coalition took over this base last week.
column2: base PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-345" type="FAC",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-10" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-9" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: It's now a major staging point.
You know you are in Iraq when you drive down the road coming into the base and see the portrait of Saddam Hussein.
column2: base PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-345" type="FAC",road PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-348" type="FAC",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-10" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: What's happen is the military personnel who have arrived here have taken out their markers and are writing messages on Saddam Hussein's portrait.
You can see the main one here on the bottom and also here messages like, we won, April 1, 2003.
Want to give you a look.
There's a lot of security personnel here.
You can look over there and you can see the military vehicles.
These are Air Force Security Forces with their rifles patrolling the entrance.
There is a lot of fighting in this area.
We're near the town of Nasiriya .
