column2: Nasiriya PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897120" id="Pl-17" latLong="31.054°N 46.259°E" state="IQ-DQ" type="PPLA"

column1: But this base now is considered secure enough to make it a major staging point for the coalition.
column2: base PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-345" type="FAC"

column1: (END VIDEOTAPE) TUCHMAN A short time ago we talked to a pilot at this base who has been to that Iraqi base and he too says he has signed that mural right on Saddam Hussein's sash.
column2: base PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-345" type="FAC",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-10" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-9" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: After he told us that, we asked him during his missions, and he's flown about 30 in the last two weeks, we asked him does he still have any artillery being fired at him?
(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP) UNIDENTIFIED MALE Yesterday I was up SIGNAL id="S-2" just south SIGNAL of Baghdad by SIGNAL id="S-1" 30 miles SIGNAL and we were fighting SA-2s and SA-6s and AAA on the ground.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: So they're still out there.
But the air power and the air package that we take to the fight, we continue to be effective.
And we attrit the Medina forces down to less than 50 percent.
column2: Medina PLACE country="SA" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897380" id="Pl-18" latLong="30.965°N 47.255°E" predicative="true" state="SA-03" type="PPL"

column1: And when we put our power punch to them and then the Army and the Marines move forward it's a very effective, coordinated effort.
(END VIDEO CLIP) TUCHMAN Lieutenant Colonel Webb (ph) is telling us he has a mission this very evening.
We want to tell you the Air Force has just informed us that between this morning and tomorrow morning, it will fly 1,900 sorties into Iraq .
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-10" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: A total over the last two weeks now of close to 24,000 sorties.
Before we go, one more thing we want to tell you about, superstitions.
Military people are very superstitious, like many of us are.
Here at this particular base they get their MREs, their MREs are their Meals Ready to Eat.
column2: base PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-345" type="FAC"

column1: They come in a bag.
And when you get an MRE you get your meal and you get a little treat with it.
What a lot of people here at this base do, when their treat happens to be this one, this is the candy called Charms, many of the people refuse to eat their Charms.
column2: base PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-345" type="FAC"

column1: They consider it a good luck charm to keep their Charms in their clothes and not to eat them.
So one little superstitious tale for you, Judy.
Back to you.
WOODRUFF Well, I'm one of those who thinks that we need to pay attention to our superstitions.
Gary, one another quick question for you.
That air base that coalition forces have now taken control of near Nasiriya .
column2: Nasiriya PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897120" id="Pl-17" latLong="31.054°N 46.259°E" state="IQ-DQ" type="PPLA",base PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-345" type="FAC"

column1: Are you able to say, are they actually using it or getting much use out of it?
TUCHMAN What they are doing, Judy, some of these A-10s behind me go there to refuel, to stage operations further north.
They also fly these HH-60 helicopters, they're the search and rescue helicopters used in case they have to search and find somebody on the ground.
They stage there and refuel.
But right now, none of them are permanently based there, although the plan is for that to eventually happen.
column2: base PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-345" type="FAC"

column1: WOODRUFF All right, Gary Tuchman with some Charms.
You saw him holding it.
I will be talking with a ranking member of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, Senator Joe Biden, just ahead, for his take on how the war is going.
Could Tony Blair be in line for a gold medal?
Tales of how some in Congress want to honor the British prime minister.
column2: British PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17389505" id="Pl-19" latLong="54.000°N 4.000°W" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Iraqis Mistakenly Believe Soldiers Have Sights on Sacred Landmark
Thanks very much, Judy.

With the power out now in Baghdad , we're getting word that loudspeakers have been blaring in the Iraqi capital , urging citizens to go to the international airport there, presumably to defend it against coalition forces.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-28" latLong="33.339Â°N 44.394Â°E" state="BG" type="PPLC",capital PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-21" latLong="33.339Â°N 44.394Â°E" state="BG" type="PPLC",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000Â°N 44.000Â°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-7" latLong="33.000Â°N 44.000Â°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Now that armored columns of U.S. -led troops have reached the outskirts SIGNAL id="S-5" of SIGNAL Baghdad , eyewitnesses report fighting and shelling around Saddam Hussein International Airport.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-28" latLong="33.339Â°N 44.394Â°E" state="BG" type="PPLC",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-16" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: In the final push to Baghdad , U.S. forces face limited resistance from Iraqi troops.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-28" latLong="33.339Â°N 44.394Â°E" state="BG" type="PPLC",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000Â°N 44.000Â°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-7" latLong="33.000Â°N 44.000Â°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-16" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: But the Pentagon believes some Iraqi Republican Guard units have withdrawn to the capital for what could be their last stand.
column2: capital PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-21" latLong="33.339Â°N 44.394Â°E" state="BG" type="PPLC",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000Â°N 44.000Â°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-7" latLong="33.000Â°N 44.000Â°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Pentagon PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:1473192" id="Pl-30" latLong="38.871Â°N 77.056Â°W" state="VA" type="FAC"

column1: Farther SIGNAL id="S-1" south SIGNAL in Basra , smoke rose over the city as coalition vehicles moved in today.
column2: Basra PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897821" id="Pl-32" latLong="30.494Â°N 47.819Â°E" state="BA" type="PPLA",city PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-18" latLong="33.339Â°N 44.394Â°E" mod="S" state="BG" type="PPLC"

column1: British forces say they're consolidating their position in Basra 's key suburbs.
column2: British PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17389505" id="Pl-34" latLong="54.000Â°N 4.000Â°W" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Basra PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897821" id="Pl-32" latLong="30.494Â°N 47.819Â°E" state="BA" type="PPLA"

column1: And in northern Iraq , Kurdish political leaders and members of the Iraqi opposition are engaged in talks with U.S. military commanders.
column2: Kurdish PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:208909932" id="Pl-36" predicative="true" type="RGN",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000Â°N 44.000Â°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-7" latLong="33.000Â°N 44.000Â°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-16" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: They reportedly are exploring the option of joining forces against Saddam Hussein.

Coalition forces launched their latest advances toward Baghdad in the pre-dawn hours today, heading toward the Iraqi capital from the SIGNAL id="S-2" southeast SIGNAL and the SIGNAL id="S-3" southwest SIGNAL .
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-28" latLong="33.339Â°N 44.394Â°E" state="BG" type="PPLC",capital PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-21" latLong="33.339Â°N 44.394Â°E" state="BG" type="PPLC",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000Â°N 44.000Â°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-7" latLong="33.000Â°N 44.000Â°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: The forces encountered limited resistance along the way and are now poised for the final assault not far from the edge of the city . Reporter Carl Dinnon of Britain 's ITN filed this report.
column2: Britain PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17389505" id="Pl-35" latLong="54.000Â°N 4.000Â°W" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",city PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-18" latLong="33.339Â°N 44.394Â°E" mod="S" state="BG" type="PPLC"

column1: (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) CARL DINNON, ITN CORRESPONDENT (voice-over) Baghdad is now within striking distance as troops make their final thrust through the desert.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-28" latLong="33.339Â°N 44.394Â°E" state="BG" type="PPLC"

column1: Wrecked armor by the sides of the road suggests there has been some Iraqi opposition.
column2: road PLACE country="IQ" id="Pl-38" type="ROAD",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000Â°N 44.000Â°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-7" latLong="33.000Â°N 44.000Â°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: But by and large, the Republican Guard has either been destroyed or has withdrawn.
And the way seems to be open for coalition forces to close in on the city 's southern limits.
column2: city PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-18" latLong="33.339Â°N 44.394Â°E" mod="S" state="BG" type="PPLC",southern PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-42" latLong="33.000Â°N 44.000Â°E" mod="S" type="COUNTRY"

column1: At daybreak, U.S. troops pushed through the outskirts SIGNAL id="S-6" of SIGNAL Karbala on the road to Baghdad , capturing a key bridge on the Euphrates River .
column2: road PLACE country="IQ" id="Pl-38" type="ROAD",Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-28" latLong="33.339Â°N 44.394Â°E" state="BG" type="PPLC",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-16" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Euphrates River PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19251239" id="Pl-39" latLong="33.083Â°N 43.483Â°E" type="WATER",Karbala PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16892923" id="Pl-37" latLong="32.250Â°N 43.117Â°E" state="KA" type="PPLA"

column1: Meanwhile, coalition commanders posted American special forces were now operating at will.
column2: American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-10" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: These dramatic pictures show a raid on a presidential palace SIGNAL id="S-4" less than 60 miles SIGNAL from Baghdad .
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-28" latLong="33.339Â°N 44.394Â°E" state="BG" type="PPLC"

column1: It seems to have been abandoned, but the United States said it was still on the trail of Saddam and his closest circle.
column2: United States PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-9" type="COUNTRY"

column1: BRIG. GEN. VINCENT BROOKS, U.S. CENTRAL COMMAND We remain cautiously optimistic.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-16" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: We don't think that the fighting is over yet, and so there are still options available to the regime, including the use of weapons of mass destruction.
We take that very seriously.
We take it in a sober fashion.
And at the same time, we remain prepared to continue operations.

DINNON The Americans say they've destroyed two divisions of the elite Republican Guard. (on camera): The Medina division, which is one of the toughest outfits in the Republican Guard is now down to 10 percent of its fighting strength.
column2: American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-10" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Medina PLACE country="SA" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897380" id="Pl-40" latLong="30.965Â°N 47.255Â°E" predicative="true" state="03" type="PPL"

column1: That means it's practically inoperative.

Others are down to 50 percent, but there's still one or two divisions around 75, 80, 90 percent of their fighting strength, and they could still put up very stiff resistance, indeed, when the American forces get en masse to Baghdad itself. (voice-over): The noose appears to be tightening on Saddam Hussein.

column1: The question is, how desperate he will get before he is finally toppled.
Carl Dinnon, ITV News, Iraq . (END VIDEOTAPE) BLITZER In the southern city of Najaf , home to one of Islam's holiest sites , moments of tension that could have gone either way earlier today.

column1: We're going to get to him shortly.
But Judy Woodruff, back in Washington , has breaking news -- Judy.

column1: Iraqis Mistakenly Believe Soldiers Have Sights on Sacred Landmark
Wolf, we're going to break in here, because the parents of Jessica Lynch, who live in Palestine , West Virginia , are before the microphones, I'm told, just about to talk with reporters.
column2: Palestine PLACE country="US" form="NAM" id="Pl-1" state="US-WV" type="PPL",West Virginia PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:1780805" id="Pl-2" latLong="38.500°N 80.500°W" state="US-WV" type="CIVIL"

column1: They're walking toward the press.
Let's listen.
GREG LYNCH SR., JESSICA LYNCH'S FATHER Good afternoon.
We appreciate y'all coming out for what you're doing for Jessie and all of the other troops that are missing.
We've been waiting all day word from the doctors, and they have successively done one surgery on her.
There will be other surgeries to do that.
It's going to take time and patience.
DEE LYNCH, JESSICA'S MOTHER But she's great and she's doing good.
G. LYNCH She's in real good spirits.
We talked to her.
D. LYNCH We talked to her before the surgery, we talked to her after the surgery, and she's doing good.
Can't you think?
G. LYNCH Yes, a bunch, but my mind's blank.
The doctor has completed one surgery on her back.
They have released the pressure on a nerve, and realigned all the disks and put plates and stuff in it, and that was because she didn't have any feeling in her feet.
So he, he's pretty sure right now that that will relieve, relieve the tension, and her feet will be able to move.
Also, we have heard and seen reports that she had multiple gunshot wounds, and knife stabbing.
The doctor has not seen any of this.
He looked for the gunshot wounds for the knife stabbing, and there is no injury whatsoever.
They will do surgery again tomorrow on her legs.
She has fractured legs and her right forearm.
And we are just waiting to get that good news too.
D. LYNCH We talked to her before and after the surgery, like I said, and she's just, she just sounded real good.
Of course, this morning she was a little groggy.
But yet, she was good, because it was early.
And then this afternoon, after the surgery, she was our Jessie again.
QUESTION If those weren't gunshot wounds to cause the broken bones, do they know what caused the fractures?
G. LYNCH They have no idea at this time what caused them.

We know she's in good spirits, because they told her they was gonna put pink casts on her legs and arms, and she had pink casts when she was in the third grade on her arm so we know she -- her mind is working good.
So she's in good spirits, and we hope the surgery will go good tomorrow, just as well as it did today.
QUESTION Can you tell us what she said to you on the telephone?
You said she was in good spirits?
Can you describe your conversation?
G. LYNCH I teased her again about the Army jeeps and she said, "I know where there's a bunch of that we can find."
So, we know she's in good spirits.
D. LYNCH She was asking for a hairbrush.
WOODRUFF Gregory Lynch, the father of Jessica Lynch, and Jessica's mother talking to reporters, saying they have talked to her today, both before and after surgery, that she says she's feeling good.
They say she will be good.
But they said the doctors did go in and apparently do some work on her spinal cord or spinal column.
He said to relieve some pressure on a nerve.
They were concerned because she didn't have feeling in her feet.
They did go on to say the doctors could not find either bullet or knife entry wounds, suggesting that her broken bones came from some other source, and it is not clear yet.
Her parents said they don't know yet what caused their daughter's injuries.
Iraqis Mistakenly Believe Soldiers Have Sights on Sacred Landmark

column1: The search turns up nothing.
The only resistance comes from a Volvo.
The Shia population seems curious and friendly but they don't get too close.
This man agrees to be interviewed as long as his face isn't shown.
The Iraqi government, he says, has satellite TV.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-5" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-6" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Anybody could be an informer and punish us for talking to you, even my family, he tells me in Arabic.
The troops also keep their distance.
UNIDENTIFIED MALE Yes, it's very uneasy out here.
Don't know who's who.
CHILCOTE Sergeant Rod Sutton from Indiana on the corner of a street leading to the highly sensitive Imam Ali Shrine , one of the holiest sites in the world for Shia Muslims.
column2: Indiana PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:449508" id="Pl-22" latLong="40.000°N 86.250°W" state="IN" type="CIVIL"

column1: Does it make you nervous that you're so close to the Ali mosque ?
Do you feel like you're tramping on.
SGT. ROD SUTTON, BASTOGNE BRIGADE Holy ground?
CHILCOTE Yes.
SUTTON To some extent, I feel fortunate that I'm here, because this is something I never would have seen before.
And now that I see it I kind of understand some of the history behind it.
So, it makes me more appreciative of it.
To the same extent, I don't want to be invasive with these people here.
I don't want to trample on their holy ground, and I want to respect that as much as I can.

CHILCOTE Word comes from the grand Ayatollah Sistani that he's willing to meet the American commander, but he asks first for soldiers to secure his compound , located SIGNAL id="S-1" halfway down SIGNAL the road to the mosque .
column2: American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-8" type="COUNTRY"

column1: No one explains that to the crowd. (on camera): There is no more striking example of the sensitivities that the U.S. soldiers face here than what is taking place on the streets right up from the ah Ali mosque right now. (voice-over): Chaos as the crowd apparently believes the soldiers want to approach the shrine . UNIDENTIFIED MALE They want to get inside the holy shrine of Imam Ali .
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-14" type="COUNTRY"

column1: CHILCOTE Clerics appear with a message from the grand Ayatollah, but the message is did drowned out.
The colonel instructs his men to stay calm.
UNIDENTIFIED MALE They got to understand, he wants us here.
Smile, relax.
CHILCOTE His soldiers take a knee, their weapons brought down from the ready position.
They do everything soldiers can to appear less hostile.
But the potential for confrontation remains.
The commander makes the decision.
UNIDENTIFIED MALE Turn around, just turn around and go.
CHILCOTE He orders his men back to their compound to await cooler heads.

Ryan Chilcote, CNN with the 101st Airborne in Najaf , Iraq . (END VIDEOTAPE) WOODRUFF And CNN's Nic Robertson telling us earlier, significant that the Shia Muslim Ayatollahs, what they did, that they were cooperating with coalition and U.S. troops, saying that that will send an important signal to Shia Muslims throughout the country . Well, U.S. officials are investigating two possible friendly fire incidents in which coalition forces may have mistakenly shot at allied aircraft.

column1: In one of the incidents, a soldier was killed and several others wounded.
Before word of that death, 40 Americans had been killed by hostile fire in Operation Iraqi Freedom.

column1: Fifteen others are said to be still missing in action.
Well, when they do finally enter Baghdad , U.S. and coalition troops could face urban combat with the Republican Guard, some of whom may have withdrawn into the city .

column1: Nevertheless, CNN's Miles O'Brien is with our military analyst, Lieutenant Colonel Robert Leonard, he is a Persian Gulf War veteran and a military science professor at West Virginia University -- Miles.
column2: West Virginia PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:1780805" id="Pl-26" latLong="38.500°N 80.500°W" state="WV" type="CIVIL"

column1: Iraqis Mistakenly Believe Soldiers Have Sights on Sacred Landmark
Thanks very much, Judy.
And Colonel Leonhard, we're going to talk a little bit about urban combat.
And I wanted to just start this off by saying a lot of people when they hear about urban combat, they think of that Blackhawk down scenario, Mogadishu and the problems that can go wrong here.
column2: Mogadishu PLACE country="SO" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16772563" id="Pl-6" latLong="2.067°N 45.367°E" predicative="true" state="SO-BN" type="PPLC"

column1: This is not probably a comparable situation, is it?
LT. COL. ROBERT LEONHARD, U.S. ARMY (RET.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-2" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: ) Not in any way.
And one of the reasons is because we have armored fighting vehicles there in Baghdad , and we will use them.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-4" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: Those tanks have 120-millimeter smoothbore gun on them.
The Bradleys have 25-millimetre chain guns and coaxial machine guns.
That's a lot of mobile protective gunfire.
Completely different from the Mogadishu situation in which we did not have such vehicles.
column2: Mogadishu PLACE country="SO" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16772563" id="Pl-6" latLong="2.067°N 45.367°E" predicative="true" state="SO-BN" type="PPLC"

column1: And we also are not going to use similar tactics there.
We are much more likely to use patience and finesse rather than assault tactics.
O'BRIEN All right.
We want to show you an animation, and share with our viewers, maybe you can point out a few things about this.
If we move in on Baghdad , and give you a sense of the kinds of targets that might be encountered in urban combat.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-4" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: What we've depicted here is something here which shows some armor sort of off the wings here, right over here is a mosque .
column2: mosque PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-234" state="IQ-BG" type="FAC"

column1: We depict that to show that's something you obviously want to stay clear as we just saw with the Ryan Chilcote piece from Najaf .
column2: Najaf PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897127" id="Pl-7" latLong="31.992°N 44.351°E" state="IQ-NA" type="PPLA"

column1: As we get a little bit closer here, in a typical scenario like this, you might very well have Republican Guard snipers up on balconies like this, and possibly up on the roofs of buildings and anti-aircraft artillery or artillery encampments like that.
What we have presented her is an armored column with air support coming in.
How much jeopardy is a column like this in as it goes through these concrete canyons in a city?
LEONHARD It's a great question.
I think the animation is good because it does show that you can hide literally anywhere in a city environment, and that is why movement through an urban area is very, very dangerous.
It's the side that's moving that's going to take the casualties.
That said, the armored fighting vehicles that you see there they look to me as if they're moving a little bit faster as than we probably will.
We'll use patience and finesse.
We will take the time to locate the enemy, surround the blocks and the buildings that he is in.
And then we'll probably surge fires into their both lethal and nonlethal to make his position untenable, to make him move rather than us moving through the assault zone.
At which time we can engage them or arrest them.
O'BRIEN We'd like to resume with that animation if we could.
That's Saddam International Airport .
column2: Saddam International Airport PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" id="Pl-231" state="IQ-BG" type="FAC"

column1: That's another segment.
Can we get back to the animation.
And I'd like to just finish this out.
Here we go.
Ad we move it along, you'll see eventually the troops will come marching in.
In this case, slightly off target here because you see them all going in the front door.
Typically, when they'd assault a target like this, they'd do what?
LEONHARD Well, typically, if they do go in, which is generally the option of last resort, but if we do have to go in, often we'll try to go in from the top of the building down.
One of the reasons is because we use grenades a lot in clearing buildings, and grenades ten to offend downhill rather than uphill.
So, you always want them going down staircases rather than having to try to throw them up the staircase.
O'BRIEN Interesting, all right.
Gravity rules, even in urban combat.
Lieutenant Colonel Robert Leonard, we appreciate your insights in urban combat, something that is not something that the U.S. military would prefer to engage in, but it might become inevitable.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-2" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Thank you very much for your time.
We appreciate it -- Judy.
WOODRUFF Thank you, Miles and thank you Colonel Leonhard.
All of that certainly helps us visualize what might happen.

column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",capital PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-11" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-6" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-26" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",base PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-280" state="IQ-BG" type="FAC"

column1: Some Republican Guard troops fought fiercely on the northern side of the airport complex . UNIDENTIFIED MALE Hopefully, this is a sign that we're able to send to the residents of Baghdad that we're here and they can rise up and deal with the regime appropriately.
column2: complex PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-278" state="IQ-BG" type="FAC",Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",airport PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-274" state="IQ-BG" type="FAC"

column1: MATES Outside the airport , the fighting was fierce, but the battle unequal.
column2: airport PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-274" state="IQ-BG" type="FAC"

column1: Here, the remains of an Iraqi armored car, and by its side the body of an Iraqi soldier, all that remains of a column that pushed up the airport road last night in a final effort to defend the airport . U.S. troops are now knocking on the door of Baghdad .
column2: road PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-282" state="IQ-BG" type="FAC",Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-6" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",airport PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-274" state="IQ-BG" type="FAC",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-26" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: But the final push into the city could yet prove to be the toughest fighting of all.
column2: city PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-10" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: (on camera): The patchy, somewhat disorganized defense of the airport last night has left coalition commanders with several questions.
column2: airport PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-274" state="IQ-BG" type="FAC"

column1: Have they done so much damage now to Iraqi command and control centers that they can no longer put up a proper fight, or are the best troops simply withdrawing into the city , to fight there street by street?
column2: city PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-10" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-6" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: The answer to that could well decide how quickly they make a final push into the city . James Mates, ITV News, with the U.S. marines, SIGNAL id="S-1" south SIGNAL of Baghdad . (END VIDEOTAPE)
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",city PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-10" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-26" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Iraq  Warns of Unconventional Counter Attack Tonight; Saddam Sends
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-1" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: BLITZER Attacking on the ground and calling in air strikes, Kurdish fighters and U.S. troops have dislodged stubborn Iraqi soldiers at a key bridge in northern Iraq .
column2: ,Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-21" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Iraqis pulled back on the road to Mosul as CNN's Jane Arraf reports from the battlefield.
column2: ,road PLACE country="IQ" id="Pl-40" type="ROAD",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Mosul PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897344" id="Pl-35" latLong="36.335°N 43.119°E" state="NI" type="PPLA"

column1: (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) JANE ARRAF, CNN CORRESPONDENT (voice-over) A few miles further to Mosul , Kurdish militia and their flags speeding to a town abandoned by Iraqi forces.
column2: ,Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",town PLACE country="IQ" gazref="IGDB:16897344" id="Pl-39" latLong="36.335°N 43.119°E" state="NI" type="PPLA",Mosul PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897344" id="Pl-35" latLong="36.335°N 43.119°E" state="NI" type="PPLA"

column1: After a day of fighting, the Iraqis were driven back five kilometers, SIGNAL id="S-1" about three miles SIGNAL down the main road SIGNAL id="S-2" west SIGNAL towards Mosul from the Kurdish city of Erbil .
column2: ,road PLACE country="IQ" id="Pl-40" type="ROAD",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Erbil PLACE country="IQ" gazref="IGDB:16893567" id="Pl-37" latLong="36.190°N 44.009°E" state="AR" type="PPLA",Mosul PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897344" id="Pl-35" latLong="36.335°N 43.119°E" state="NI" type="PPLA"

column1: Soldiers were Kurdish , but the special forces calling in air strikes on Iraqi positions were American .
column2: ,American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-17" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: As U.S. warplanes dropped bombs near the town , Kurdish fighters moved forward. (on camera): There's a slow-and-steady battle going on here for control of the key bridge.
column2: ,U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-21" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",town PLACE country="IQ" gazref="IGDB:16897344" id="Pl-39" latLong="36.335°N 43.119°E" state="NI" type="PPLA"

column1: It's a bridge over the river on the main road to Mosul .
column2: ,road PLACE country="IQ" id="Pl-40" type="ROAD",Mosul PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897344" id="Pl-35" latLong="36.335°N 43.119°E" state="NI" type="PPLA",river PLACE country="IQ" id="Pl-41" type="WATER"

column1: The Iraqis are firing artillery like that in response to the Americans are calling in air strikes.
column2: ,American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-17" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: The Peshmerga are just down the road, and the Iraqis have retreated, but they're still holding on to the bridge. (voice-over): That blast turned out to be a rocket-propelled grenade, but there's plenty of artillery and mortar fire to come.
column2: ,road PLACE country="IQ" id="Pl-40" type="ROAD",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: UNIDENTIFIED MALE Are you coming here?
ARRAF Less than 20 minutes later, with Iraqi defenses pounded by the bombing, they no longer held the bridge over the Khoser River .
column2: ,Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Khoser River PLACE country="IQ" id="Pl-44" type="WATER"

column1: In this vehicle, the only Iraqi casualties we saw.
column2: ,Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Their military radio and guns indicating they were combatants. (on camera): It's still smoldering, this truck with three Iraqi soldiers.
column2: ,Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: It was either shelled or bombed.
Now, it's a small part of this battle for the bridge just behind us.
These were lying on the ground next to the truck.
Somebody picked them up.
It's an I.D. card, presumably for one of the soldiers.
The only thing you can really tell from it is that he was 27 years old.
And a snapshot from when his life was still ahead of him.
Other evidence of a hurried retreat amid the smoldering vehicles, a discarded gas mask.
Military documents.
Notebooks with verses from the Koran.
Kurdish fighters planted their flag and left it waving in the smoke of the bombed-out Iraqi truck.
column2: ,Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: The village of Manguba (ph), SIGNAL id="S-3" just 32 kilometers SIGNAL , SIGNAL id="S-4" about 23 miles SIGNAL from Mosul is now in Kurdish hands.
column2: ,Manguba PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16891757" id="Pl-43" latLong="36.300°N 43.567°E" state="NI" type="PPL",Mosul PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897344" id="Pl-35" latLong="36.335°N 43.119°E" state="NI" type="PPLA"

column1: One Kurdish soldier did the honors of tearing up a poster of Saddam Hussein.
Not just the poster, but the frame and cardboard backing as well.
They've been waiting a long time.
Jane Arraf, CNN, on the bridge over the Khoser River in northern Iraq . (END VIDEO CLIP) BLITZER Thanks very much.
column2: ,Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Khoser River PLACE country="IQ" id="Pl-44" type="WATER"

column1: Judy, dangerous assignment for all of our reporters, our embedded journalists.
And one of them, not from our CNN, but from a very close friend of all of ours, Michael Kelly, paid that price.
The first American embedded journalist to have gotten killed in covering this war.
column2: ,American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-17" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: We'll have more on him at 5:00 on our special edition of "WOLF BLITZER REPORTS." Until then, thanks, Judy, back to you.
WOODRUFF Thanks, Wolf.
And we'll be watching.

Michael Kelly, of course, with " Atlantic Monthly," and a columnist for the " Washington Post." Well, at least three U.S. service members were killed today in an apparent suicide bomb attack at a checkpoint near the Haditah Dam northwest of Baghdad .
column2: ,Washington PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:532871" id="Pl-46" latLong="38.895°N 77.037°W" state="DC" type="PPLC",Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-15" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC",Haditah PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16894456" id="Pl-48" latLong="34.140°N 42.378°E" state="AN" type="PPL",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-21" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Those deaths are not yet included in the official casualty count.
At last report, though, 41 Americans had been killed by hostile forces, 13 others by friendly fire or in accidents.
column2: ,American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-17" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Of the 27 British troops, in all who have been killed, at least 19 of them were said to be victims of friendly fire or accidents.
column2: ,British PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17389505" id="Pl-51" latLong="54.000°N 4.000°W" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: The official Iraqi casualty figures remain the same this day, including more than 400 civilians killed, Iraqi authorities say.
column2: ,Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: And U.S. Central Command says more than 4,000 Iraqis have been captured, but British officials believe that figure is much higher.
column2: ,British PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17389505" id="Pl-51" latLong="54.000°N 4.000°W" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-21" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: We know that seven Americans are known to be held as prisoner of war in Iraq .
column2: ,American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-17" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Another 15 Americans listed as missing in action.
column2: ,American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-17" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Well, funeral services were held today in Colorado for 21-year- old Marine Corporal Randall Kent Rosacker.
column2: ,Colorado PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:1780779" id="Pl-52" latLong="39.000°N 105.500°W" state="CO" type="CIVIL"

column1: He was killed in action in Iraq .
column2: ,Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: His story is especially poignant.
His father is a navy commander.
He received word of his son's death within hours after the submarine that he was assigned to returned home from an extended deployment.
The Iraqis promise an unconventional attack on U.S. troops tonight.
column2: ,Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-21" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Do they mean guerilla warfare, as in Vietnam ?
column2: ,Vietnam PLACE country="VN" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16266660" id="Pl-53" latLong="16.167°N 107.833°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: We're going to ask our military analyst.
That's coming up.
Coalition Troops Penetrate Outskirts of Baghdad
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-24" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC"

column1: Thanks, Wolf.
And we will see you then.
Well, as coalition forces push ahead in their bid to capture Baghdad , big questions remain about Saddam Hussein and his whereabouts.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-23" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC"

column1: It is still not clear, looking at the latest tapes of the Iraqi president, whether he's dead or alive.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-15" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: CNN senior international correspondent Nic Robertson, who was expelled from Baghdad , is with us now from the border of Iraq and Jordan , on the Jordanian side, to talk about what's happening in the Iraqi capital . Nic, we're getting information in bits and pieces about the incursion by coalition land forces, about air flights over the city . Help us pull it all together.
column2: Jordanian PLACE country="JO" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19027984" id="Pl-32" latLong="31.000°N 36.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Jordan PLACE country="JO" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19027984" id="Pl-31" latLong="31.000°N 36.000°E" mod="BORDER" type="COUNTRY",Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-23" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC",capital PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-18" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-15" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",city PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16897821" id="Pl-43" latLong="30.494°N 47.819°E" state="BA" type="PPLA",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: NIC ROBERTSON, CNN SENIOR INTERNATIONAL CORRESPONDENT Well, from what we hear from sources in Baghdad this evening, it had been mostly quiet in terms of bombing throughout the day in Baghdad .
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-23" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC"

column1: Then there was a large explosion not far from the hotel journalists are staying in in the center of Baghdad .
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-23" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC"

column1: Along the riverfront there, there are a number of Ba'ath Party houses and buildings that appear to be -- have some sort of military function.
It's not clear exactly what the target was.
What we're hearing from Iraqi people in the capital today is that they know and they have seen coalition forces in the southwest of the city , in the southeast of the city .
column2: capital PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-18" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-15" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",city PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16897821" id="Pl-43" latLong="30.494°N 47.819°E" state="BA" type="PPLA",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: They say they have also seen coalition forces and believe coalition forces have a checkpoint on the northern outskirts of Baghdad as well.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-23" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC"

column1: So as far as the Iraqi people are concerned, they are very aware that coalition forces are right on the perimeter of the city . Our sources are also telling us that Iraqi forces are massing artillery pieces and tanks at a number of locations on the southwestern edge of the city .
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-15" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",city PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16897821" id="Pl-43" latLong="30.494°N 47.819°E" state="BA" type="PPLA",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: These locations, actually, very close to the center of Baghdad and appear to be forming something sort of front line against the coalition forces.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-23" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC"

column1: Now, Iraq 's minister of information today said that the coalition did not have control of the airport, that this was some sort of contrived video from the first day, and that, in fact, hundreds of coalition soldiers had been killed, and their graves were now at the airport.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-15" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: He did promise to take journalists to the airport, however, he never made -- he didn't make good on that promise throughout the day.

The information minister also read a statement from President Saddam Hussein today, the Iraqi leader calling on people to be resolute, to be strong, and saying that if they put up a good fight, then the coalition would eventually back down. (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP) MOHAMMED SAEED AL-SAHAF, IRAQI INFORMATION MINISTER (through translator) But to harm the enemy more and more, go against the enemy and destroy the enemy and follow the plans that you got in writing.
column2: IRAQI PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-9" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-15" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: God is great.
May the criminals lose.

(END VIDEO CLIP) ROBERTSON Now, representatives of the committee -- the International Committee for the Red Cross, who have been to some of the hospitals in Baghdad , report higher-than-usual numbers of casualties coming into those hospitals.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-23" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC"

column1: (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP) ROLAND NUGUENIN-BENJAMIN, INTERNATIONAL COMMITTEE OF THE RED CROSS (on phone) We had a chance in the morning to go to the main hospital, which is called Yarmuk (ph), and we found there has been a steady flow in of hundreds of casualties, all over the night and through into the day, casualties -- I mean, war wounded had to be sent over, dispatched to other hospitals, because this Yarmuk was just totally overwhelmed by the sheer number of people coming in.
(END VIDEO CLIP) ROBERTSON Now, these Red Cross representatives say that most -- that two-thirds of the casualties they've seen in this particular hospital are, in fact, military casualties.

And Iraqi officials promise to take journalists to this particular hospital, the Yarmuk Hospital, that is now located, it's on the southwest of Baghdad , and it appears to be pretty much between the position of where coalition forces have been seen and where Iraq now has a militarized front-line position.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-23" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-15" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Now, when journalists were taken to see that hospital, twice they were turned around and told that they weren't actually allowed to go inside that hospital, Judy.

WOODRUFF Nic, when you say Iraqis are seen now putting artillery pieces out and around the city , are you saying out in the open, where they can -- where they are vulnerable, or are they making any attempt to hide them?
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-15" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",city PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16897821" id="Pl-43" latLong="30.494°N 47.819°E" state="BA" type="PPLA",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Give us clearer picture of that.
ROBERTSON One of the areas where I understand they're locating tanks and artillery pieces is the Zawara (ph) Park.
This is fairly central in Baghdad on the edge of a government area.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-23" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC"

column1: It is a garden -- it is a large garden-type area for people to take their children to go and play.
It's -- there's a small zoo there as well.
It is, if you will, on the -- facing towards the southwestern area of the city .
column2: city PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16897821" id="Pl-43" latLong="30.494°N 47.819°E" state="BA" type="PPLA"

column1: It faces off against the highway that leads out to the airport.
Now, that is not in a residential area.
It is a clear, open area, apart from trees.
The other areas that we understand where Iraqi officials are placing tanks and blocking off streets are in more residential areas, Judy.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-15" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: WOODRUFF All right.
Nic Robertson, giving us a better understanding of exactly what the Iraqis are doing to prepare for any further moves by coalition forces.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-15" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Nic, thank you very much.

Well, as American forces do push ahead toward the Iraqi government's key center of power, British forces are keeping up their work to the SIGNAL id="S-1" south SIGNAL of the Iraqi capital . ITN reporter Juliet Bremner is embedded with British forces in Iraq 's second-largest city , Basra , where the fight for control goes on.
column2: American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-30" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",British PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17389505" id="Pl-41" latLong="54.000°N 4.000°W" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Basra PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897821" id="Pl-42" latLong="30.494°N 47.819°E" state="BA" type="PPLA",capital PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-18" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-15" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",city PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16897821" id="Pl-43" latLong="30.494°N 47.819°E" state="BA" type="PPLA",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Coalition Troops Penetrate Outskirts of Baghdad
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-6" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: Dominating the city gates to Basra .
column2: Basra PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897821" id="Pl-11" latLong="30.494°N 47.819°E" state="IQ-BA" type="PPLA",city PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16897821" id="Pl-9" latLong="30.494°N 47.819°E" state="IQ-BA" type="PPLA"

column1: Saddam Hussein and his henchmen still claim to control this southern port .
column2: port PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-241" type="FAC",southern PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="S" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: But the British want to send a powerful symbolic message.
column2: British PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17389505" id="Pl-16" latLong="54.000°N 4.000°W" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Soldiers are here to tear down the regime and all it stands for.
By the time they leave Iraq , they're determined Saddam and his Ba'ath Party will have bitten the dust.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-4" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="S" type="COUNTRY"

column1: The approach can seem frustratingly slow, but day by day, the Desert Rats are exerting more control.
Checkpoints meant to filter out Iraqi hardliners.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-4" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="S" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-5" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: (on camera): They're well within striking distance of the mortars and rockets of the Fedayeen militia, but they're prepared to take that risk to try and persuade the people of Basra that they won't desert them, that they'll stick with this however messy it gets. (voice-over): Drastic action is need to convince a dubious population.
column2: Basra PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897821" id="Pl-11" latLong="30.494°N 47.819°E" state="IQ-BA" type="PPLA"

column1: UNIDENTIFIED MALE Get down, get down!
BREMNER We watched a nighttime raid on the homes of Ba'ath Party officials and Fedayeen militia.
These are men singled out by locals and believed by army intelligence to be behind much of the brutality and corruption.
Most are not accused of specific crimes but suspected of being part of the state-sponsored climate of fear.
UNIDENTIFIED MALE (UNINTELLIGIBLE), get up!
BREMNER The party's influence extends to every corner of Iraqi society.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-4" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="S" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-5" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: In two small communities, we witnessed more than 70 people being rounded up.
Some are clearly terrified of what lies ahead, uncertain of their fate, overcome by nerves.
But as it ended, there was no British apology for the scale of the operation.
column2: British PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17389505" id="Pl-16" latLong="54.000°N 4.000°W" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: UNIDENTIFIED MALE We came in firm, we came in fair.
There was no shots fired.
We gave a good warning before we came in.
We've been playing warnings to people to stay in their houses, and we've only lifted those people we've got very good intelligence on.
BREMNER This is not a tactic that can be regularly repeated, or the British risk being accused of installing their own rule of terror.
column2: British PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17389505" id="Pl-16" latLong="54.000°N 4.000°W" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Despite the discomfort of a few, there's a conviction that this is a night's work that will benefit the majority.
Juliet Bremner in Basra . (END VIDEOTAPE) WOODRUFF Well, there has been a terrible discovery by some other British troops in southern Iraq .
column2: southern PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="S" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",British PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17389505" id="Pl-16" latLong="54.000°N 4.000°W" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Basra PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897821" id="Pl-11" latLong="30.494°N 47.819°E" state="IQ-BA" type="PPLA",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-4" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="S" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Up next, evidence at a makeshift morgue points to mass executions by the Iraqi regime.
column2: morgue PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-240" type="FAC",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-4" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="S" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-5" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: But first, more scenes from today's fighting in Baghdad .
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-7" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: Coalition Troops Penetrate Outskirts of Baghdad
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: MILES O'BRIEN, CNN CORRESPONDENT (voice-over) Seven-eleven a.
m. a.m.
Eastern, 4:11 p.m. in Iraq .
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-4" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: At its daily briefing, U.S. Central Command says Operation Iraqi Freedom is far from finished in Baghdad , even though U.S. forces are inside the Iraqi capital . Eight-fifteen a.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-18" type="COUNTRY",Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-13" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" mod="CENTRAL" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",capital PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-4" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-5" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: m. a.m.
Iraq 's information minister reads a message he says is from Saddam Hussein urging Iraqis to step up attacks against coalition forces.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-4" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-5" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Eight-thirty-six a.
m. a.m.
Walter Rodgers reports according to Army sources, Iraqi officials are fleeing Baghdad in droves, using civilian convoys top avoid being targeted by coalition air strikes.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-13" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" mod="CENTRAL" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-4" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-5" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Eight-forty-three a.
m. a.m.
CNN Pentagon correspondent Barbara Starr reports coalition troops entering Baghdad were met with fierce fighting, and there were casualties on both sides.
column2: Pentagon PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:1473192" id="Pl-228" latLong="38.871°N 77.056°W" state="US-VA" type="FAC",Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-13" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" mod="CENTRAL" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: Nine-oh-six a.
m. a.m.

CNN's Martin Savidge, embedded with the 1st Battalion, 7th Marines, reports the unit has reached the extreme southeast suburbs of Baghdad , adding to forces the U.S. says now encircle the city . Twelve-thirteen p.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-18" type="COUNTRY",Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-13" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" mod="CENTRAL" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",city PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-7" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: m. p.m.
At the Pentagon , Barbara Starr reports officials say today begins a new strategy in the skies over Baghdad .
column2: Pentagon PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:1473192" id="Pl-228" latLong="38.871°N 77.056°W" state="US-VA" type="FAC",Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-13" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" mod="CENTRAL" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: The coalition air force will begin providing urban combat air support over the city .
column2: city PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-7" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: Now the operating plan includes both ground and air missions.
Twelve-twenty-one p.m. CNN's Wolf Blitzer reports according to an eyewitness, a bomb has hit central Baghdad only a few hundred meters from the Palestine Hotel .
column2: Hotel PLACE country="PS" form="NAM" id="Pl-230" type="FAC",Palestine PLACE country="PS" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:208674239" id="Pl-20" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-13" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" mod="CENTRAL" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: The Palestine Hotel is where much of the international press corps is based.
column2: Hotel PLACE country="PS" form="NAM" id="Pl-230" type="FAC",Palestine PLACE country="PS" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:208674239" id="Pl-20" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: (END VIDEOTAPE)
Coalition Troops Penetrate Outskirts of Baghdad
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-1" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: Well, U.S. forces entering Baghdad do face the prospect of urban combat, a type of battle they have trained for, but, of course, they would prefer to avoid.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-5" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-2" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: For more now on the unique challenges posed by urban combat, let's go back to Atlanta and join the man whose voice we just heard, Miles O'Brien.
column2: Atlanta PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:352615" id="Pl-6" latLong="33.749°N 84.388°W" state="US-GA" type="PPLA"

column1: Hello again, Miles.
O'BRIEN Hello again, Judy.
I'm joined by J. Kelly McCann, our security analyst, a man who's spent a lot of time learning about urban combat.
You know, just those two words together, I think, scare a lot of people because of all the things that can go wrong.
You know, I'm impressed, looking at this map, it almost looks like a chess game, kind of sterile.
That is -- couldn't be further from the truth, could it?
J. KELLY MCCANN, CNN SECURITY ANALYST Absolutely not.
This is very clean and it's very orderly.
Suddenly when we show the videotape and we start to go there, you'll see just how conflicted an environment that is.
O'BRIEN And all happening so quickly.
MCCANN (UNINTELLIGIBLE).
O'BRIEN Let's roll some tape.
We're going to kind of play it and stop it, and Kelly's going to walk us through, I guess, Urban Combat 101.
What are we seeing here?
MCCANN Just there, I mean, just getting the door out of the way, you can see where the weapons have to go.
Now, you just see this soldier right here, he's going to his sidearm to make a little bit more mobile.
And he's got to be careful of his muzzle pointing at his partner right here.
Now, he's going to go that direction, because that room is clear.
column2: room PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-227" state="US-BG" type="FAC"

column1: Go ahead and stop the tape.As you make every entry, Miles, there are two dead spots, one, of course, in this direction right here, which you can't see from the doorway, the other in this direction right here, and that's always the problem, because as you come in here, you've got to be able to get in there quickly and make sure that this person here doesn't get shot in the back.
So... O'BRIEN All right.
Now, what about this, this armor?
Tell us how they're equipped with armor there.
MCCANN Level 4 armor, this is not just for frag.
This will also stop bullets.
And there's a difference.
The normal flak jacket will stop fragments from grenades, et cetera.
This is a plate that will actually stop and deform a bullet.
O'BRIEN All right.
Let's roll tape and continue on here and talk about -- Now, I notice his hand -- his sidearm is attached to him.
That's for.
.. for..
. for...
MCCANN Exactly..
. O'BRIEN ... (UNINTELLIGIBLE).
.. (UNINTELLIGIBLE)..
. (UNINTELLIGIBLE)...
MCCANN ... (UNINTELLIGIBLE) retention, for retention capability.
So he goes down the hallway , and you can see once that's called clear, straight trigger finger, in case there's any sympathetic muscle tightening, there's no problem.
column2: hallway PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-233" state="US-BG" type="FAC"

column1: You'll see another person come right up here, and he'll hold on this door, because that's not been cleared space yet, again, straight trigger finger, but ready to shoot if he needs to.
O'BRIEN Sort of ready but not quite (UNINTELLIGIBLE).
MCCANN Absolutely.
O'BRIEN (UNINTELLIGIBLE).
MCCANN Immediately making entry with the thing, and then pying (ph) the room out, getting angles of vision as they clear it.
column2: room PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-227" state="US-BG" type="FAC"

column1: But look at that, a dark space from a lighted space.
Who knows what's in the recesses?
O'BRIEN All right.
Let's roll that second tape quickly, and we'll show you a couple more tips from Kelly's perspective.
So far, what we're seeing is pretty much textbook.
MCCANN Absolutely. (UNINTELLIGIBLE)..
. (UNINTELLIGIBLE)...
O'BRIEN All right.
Now, this is a rural setting, but this could be applied to urban combat, yes.
MCCANN Very different circumstance.
Same thing when you come into a building.
But stop the tape right here..
. here...
O'BRIEN Oop, we missed it, we missed it.
MCCANN ... if you would, (UNINTELLIGIBLE) -- It's all right.
You can see all this area.
column2: area PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-231" state="US-BG" type="RGN"

column1: .. area..
column2: area PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-231" state="US-BG" type="RGN"

column1: . area...
column2: area PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-231" state="US-BG" type="RGN"

column1: O'BRIEN No, just roll it.
MCCANN ... out here.
Just go ahead and roll it.
All of that has to be accounted for as well, not just the space in here.
Your back is not covered.
Many angles you've got to watch for.
Now, you see right here, he's got a sidearm, he's calling the team in.
All the rear is -- Now, stop the tape.
O'BRIEN Yes, (UNINTELLIGIBLE).
MCCANN Imagine a person that is concealed anywhere in here.
I mean, you could have anyone with a rifle back in these areas here.
column2: area PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-231" state="US-BG" type="RGN"

column1: .. here..
. here...
O'BRIEN Up in this area here, here.
column2: area PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-231" state="US-BG" type="RGN"

column1: .. here..
. here...
MCCANN ... in any of these recesses back over here.
O'BRIEN Oop.
MCCANN I mean, you know, you're looking at -- he wouldn't have a bomb (UNINTELLIGIBLE).
.. (UNINTELLIGIBLE)..
. (UNINTELLIGIBLE)...
O'BRIEN No, he wouldn't have that.
But let me ask you this.
Also that the garb, (UNINTELLIGIBLE) there's a cultural issue here.
That provides a lot of cover for weapons if need be, right?
MCCANN Absolutely.
And someones might say, Well, why put their hands on their head like this?
Because, you know, you -- the hands hurt.
And I won't be able to determine what you're doing with your face.
Where are your hands and what do they hold?
O'BRIEN All right.
Let's roll it real quickly and we'll make a few more points, if we could.
A lot of fear in their faces here.
You see, by the way, they all have radios, I notice they have, like, a little headset there.
That allows them to communicate (UNINTELLIGIBLE).
.. (UNINTELLIGIBLE)..
. (UNINTELLIGIBLE)...
MCCANN Immediate communications, absolutely.
You see them having their sectors of fire.
All these areas up in here, you know, could be subjected to people hiding, et cetera.
column2: area PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-231" state="US-BG" type="RGN"

column1: Now you've got people coming down that have already been cleared.
Look at the fear on the faces.
They don't understand what's going on.
O'BRIEN And you want to keep them calm, and.
.. and..
. and...
MCCANN Very calm, reassure them that this isn't about them.
O'BRIEN Wow.
MCCANN Now, here's a little bit more aggressive stance.
Exactly.
Go ahead and stop tape.
.. tape..
. tape...
O'BRIEN Stop it right there.
Oh, we missed it again.
MCCANN ... if you can.
Obviously, that person is doing something that that soldier didn't appreciate.
O'BRIEN I would say aggressive is a good word for that.
.. that..
. that...
MCCANN Absolutely.
O'BRIEN ... the business end of that M-16.
All right, Kelly McCann, thank you for some insights.
And that -- compound that SIGNAL id="S-1" by SIGNAL a city of 5 million, it kind of boggles the mind and really gives you a sense of what lies head for U.S. and coalition forces.
column2: compound PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-236" type="FAC",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-5" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",city PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-3" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: Thanks very much for your insights.
MCCANN Pleasure, Miles.
O'BRIEN Judy.
WOODRUFF Thanks, Miles and Kelly.
I've always wondered what happened -- who covers the last man or woman in one of those operations, but that's something for your next conversation.
Coalition Troops Penetrate Outskirts of Baghdad
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-1" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: Thanks very much.
An investigation is under way at a makeshift morgue in southern Iraq after a gruesome discovery by some British troops.
column2: ,British PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17389505" id="Pl-9" latLong="54.000°N 4.000°W" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-5" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="CENTRAL" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Tim Ewart of ITN News reports on evidence of atrocities at an abandoned Iraqi military base . (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) TIM EWART, ITV NEWS (voice-over) It was a discovery that horrified the soldiers who made it.
column2: ,Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-5" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="CENTRAL" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-6" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="CENTRAL" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: The remains of hundreds of men were found in plastic bags and Unsealed hard-board coffins.
British troops found the bodies at an abandoned Iraqi military base on the outskirts of Azubayr .
column2: ,Azubayr PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16887301" id="Pl-11" latLong="31.183°N 46.117°E" state="IQ-DQ",British PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17389505" id="Pl-9" latLong="54.000°N 4.000°W" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-5" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="CENTRAL" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-6" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="CENTRAL" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: The evidence suggested it was the scene of appalling atrocities.
The teeth in many of the skulls had been broken, and bones appeared to be wrapped in strips of military uniform.
It's not clear how long the bodies had lain here, but they were clearly not from this war.
UNIDENTIFIED MALE You come to expect everything in war fighting.
The coffins were there.
It was a bit more of a surprise when I discovered the bags with the human remains inside.
EWART Inside a neighboring building , there was evidence of cells and a catalog of photographs of the dead.
Most had died from gunshot wounds to the head.
Others were mutilated beyond recognition, their faces burned and swollen.
Outside, soldiers discovered what they described as a purpose- built shooting gallery , the brickwork behind it riddled with bullets.
Identity cards revealed the names of some of the dead.
Forensic specialists will now visit the scene and hope to establish the truth of what happened here and when.
(on camera): Today's discovery seems to provide shocking evidence of atrocities under Saddam Hussein's regime.
Most people are afraid to talk openly about what's been happening here.
But when they do, British soldiers believe, more horrors will come to light.
column2: ,British PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17389505" id="Pl-9" latLong="54.000°N 4.000°W" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Tim Ewart, ITV News, Azubayr . (END VIDEOTAPE) WOODRUFF Well, from a gruesome finding to a dangerous one in central Iraq .
column2: ,Azubayr PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16887301" id="Pl-11" latLong="31.183°N 46.117°E" state="IQ-DQ",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-5" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="CENTRAL" type="COUNTRY"

column1: U.S. troops work to clear that area of Iraqi weapons, coming up.
column2: ,U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-12" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-5" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="CENTRAL" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-6" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="CENTRAL" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Coalition Troops Penetrate Outskirts of Baghdad
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" mod="BORDER" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: We've been hearing about the situation in northern and southern Iraq .
column2: northern PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-16" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="N" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-7" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Now to central Iraq , where coalition forces say they are now in charge.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-7" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: And they are coming across some major munitions finds.
The caches were apparently abandoned by retreating Iraqi forces.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-7" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-6" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: One such cache turned up in the city of Karbala , a strategic military point SIGNAL id="S-1" about 60 miles SIGNAL to the SIGNAL id="S-2" south SIGNAL of Baghdad .
column2: Karbala PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16892923" id="Pl-17" latLong="32.250°N 43.117°E" state="IQ-KA" type="PPLA",Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-13" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: CNN's Ryan Chilcote is embedded with the 101st Airborne Division, and he has the story.
(BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) RYAN CHILCOTE, CNN CORRESPONDENT Can you show us what you've been finding today?
SGT. 1ST CLASS LARRY CLARK, U.S. ARMY Roger.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-9" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Well, this is about the third cache we've found today.
We've been finding them nonstop, and it's a really tedious affair.
I've got an assortment of weapons right here, ranging from AK-47s, to over here, behind them, you'll see mortar sights, 60-millimeter and 81.
Off on the far left, you'll see a second-generation starscope, kind of outdated, but still works.
If you keep shifting over, you'll see stabilizer fins for mortar rounds.
On the back here, you'll see both 60- and 82-millimeter mortars.
CHILCOTE These are well equipped.
CLARK Well, they're very well equipped.
Definitely put up a fight.
Rocket-propelled grenades.
Been finding a lot of these lately.
These could take out a Jeep or a Humvee in a heartbeat.
CHILCOTE Now, is this a -- you said you'd seen a lot of weapons caches recently found.
CLARK (UNINTELLIGIBLE).
CHILCOTE Is this a large cache?
CLARK No, I'd say this is about a medium cache.
