What... CHILCOTE This looks like a lot of weapons.
CLARK It looks like a lot of weapons, but it's really not.
This -- technically, this would probably would outfit a platoon, a platoon of (UNINTELLIGIBLE).
CHILCOTE OK.
CLARK Keep going on.
This is a little bit more advanced, these are 25-millimeter shells, and each one of those silver boxes you see behind them hold 50 of these shells.
That's a little bit above us.
That's actually going into mechanized and armor.
CHILCOTE All right.
And you were talking about the makers, where some of these weapons are coming from, and you were expressing surprise to me.
CLARK Roger.
A majority of these are coming from -- (UNINTELLIGIBLE) on this box, but Jordan and France .
column2: France PLACE country="FR" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:18572019" id="Pl-21" latLong="46.000°N 2.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Jordan PLACE country="JO" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19027984" id="Pl-19" latLong="31.000°N 36.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: We have a very scattered, limited, and Russian equipment, but like I said, France and Jordan are the main suppliers right here.
column2: France PLACE country="FR" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:18572019" id="Pl-21" latLong="46.000°N 2.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Russian PLACE country="RU" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17005945" id="Pl-22" latLong="60.000°N 100.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Jordan PLACE country="JO" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19027984" id="Pl-19" latLong="31.000°N 36.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: CHILCOTE Now for your guys, this is dangerous work, finding.
.. finding..
. finding...
CLARK It's -- yes, it's extremely dangerous, because once you enter these buildings, we found, actually, enemy, you know, guarding these sites.
Don't know if they're going to be booby trapped.
Don't know what -- what's going to be there.
So it's very tedious, it's -- got to be careful about it.
(END VIDEOTAPE) WOODRUFF Well, we've heard a whole lot about Iraq 's use of human shields in defending key sites.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-7" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Coalition fighters, though, use a different kind of shield.
In a CNN exclusive, CNN's Kyra Phillips offers us a ride-along over the city of Baghdad with some airborne bodyguards.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-13" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) UNIDENTIFIED MALE We won't consider the mission a success unless the Marines are happy with the product.
KYRA PHILLIPS, CNN CORRESPONDENT (voice-over) They are coalition bodyguards over Baghdad , an airborne shield to U.S. Marines.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-9" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-13" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: UNIDENTIFIED MALE Let them know what's coming.
Let them know if anything is coming back behind them on their franks to close off the supply lines.
PHILLIPS You're now airborne over Iraq with Commander Steve Kroto's (ph) Gray Knights, the Navy's P-3 eyes in the sky.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-7" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: UNIDENTIFIED MALE Any kind of forces that look like they may be threatening the Marines, you know, we want to let them know.
And we have the capability to send pictures or actual video, and then they can make (UNINTELLIGIBLE) if they want to maybe avoid that area or go ahead and go out and engage those folks.
PHILLIPS Dodging missiles and triple-A fire is something new to this squadron.
However, protecting forces on the ground isn't. (on camera): These men are about three hours into their mission, and the sun is starting to set.

They've just come across one of the Marine convoys that they need to track, so they're watching every move that the Marines make as they move towards Baghdad , making sure they don't come across any type of threat.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-13" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: UNIDENTIFIED MALE We're getting closer to it.
PHILLIPS (voice-over) Also on this mission, Marine Colonel Jim Lukeman (ph) and Sergeant Emilio Hernandez.
They are tracking and talking to their fellow Marines on the ground.
.. ground..
. ground...
UNIDENTIFIED MALE Two vehicles move across the bridge.
.. bridge..
. bridge...
PHILLIPS ... making sure they don't get ambushed.
UNIDENTIFIED MALE I'm looking for enemy positions out to the front.
We'll look at the routes ahead of where our guys are going to go and try to see what enemy is there.
PHILLIPS Lukeman is warning his troops about a bridge ahead.
He doesn't like what he sees.
The Gray Knights fly closer and grab a clearer picture.
UNIDENTIFIED MALE There's some vehicular traffic, so that we know the bridge is still intact.
They may be Iraqi military.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-7" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-6" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: So now that the Marine division on the ground has that information, they'll take that action -- they'll take action tactically on it.
PHILLIPS These flights can last up to 15 hours, but it's the minutes of realtime intelligence that completes the mission.
UNIDENTIFIED MALE When you're on the ground fighting, every piece of information you've got about what you're coming up against is golden.
PHILLIPS Commander Steve Kroto brings his crew home after locating enemy positions and surface-to-surface missiles.
UNIDENTIFIED MALE It keeps the Marines safe.
And one more safe Marine is one more Marine that can continue on SIGNAL id="S-3" north SIGNAL to Baghdad .
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-13" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: PHILLIPS Flying over Iraq , Kyra Phillips, CNN. (END VIDEOTAPE) WOODRUFF Coming up, we are going to go live to Fort Bliss , where the name of that base is a far cry from the mood there today, after confirmation that more of their own were killed on the battlefield.
column2: Fort Bliss PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" id="Pl-97" type="FAC",base PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-95" type="FAC",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-7" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: War in Iraq
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-1" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: An apparent friendly fire incident in northern Iraq is taking more of a toll on Kurdish leaders than we knew at first.
column2: Kurdish PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:20032588" id="Pl-17" latLong="36.288°N 42.174°E" predicative="true" type="PPL",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-2" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="N" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Eighteen people are now reported dead.
And there are late reports that the 45 wounded include the brother and a son of a Kurdish political leader.
column2: Kurdish PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:20032588" id="Pl-17" latLong="36.288°N 42.174°E" predicative="true" type="PPL"

column1: Julian Manyon of ITN has more from Northern Iraq . (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) JULIAN MANYON, ITN CORRESPONDENT (voice-over) It is another friendly fire disaster.
column2: Northern Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-3" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="N" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-2" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="N" type="COUNTRY"

column1: This morning, an American bomb destroyed a convoy carrying high officials of the Kurdish Peshmerga forces, which have been fighting alongside the Americans on the northern front.
column2: Kurdish PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:20032588" id="Pl-17" latLong="36.288°N 42.174°E" predicative="true" type="PPL",American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-12" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: At least 17 Kurdish commanders and their guards were killed, along with an interpreter working for the BBC.
column2: Kurdish PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:20032588" id="Pl-17" latLong="36.288°N 42.174°E" predicative="true" type="PPL"

column1: More than 40 were injured.

The military chief of the Kurdish KDP, the brother of their leader, Massud Barzani (ph), was gravely hurt. (on camera): Trying to organize a northern front with just a few hundred U.S. Special Forces troops and the poorly armed Kurdish Peshmerga guerrillas was always going to be a high-risk exercise.
column2: Kurdish PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:20032588" id="Pl-17" latLong="36.288°N 42.174°E" predicative="true" type="PPL",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-15" type="COUNTRY"

column1: The idea was to open the way with heavy sustained American bombing of Iraqi positions.
column2: American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-12" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-2" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="N" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: But today, it all went disastrously wrong. (voice-over): Even as we filmed the wreckage, U.S. jets were still dropping their bombs nearby.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-15" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Giant explosions erupted down the road . Earlier, we had joined another convoy of U.S. Special Forces troops and Kurdish fighters as they tried to move south through country abandoned by the Iraqi army.
column2: Kurdish PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:20032588" id="Pl-17" latLong="36.288°N 42.174°E" predicative="true" type="PPL",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-15" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-2" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="N" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: At first, all was calm.
American troops controlled the operation from a rooftop.
column2: American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-12" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Then, as the Kurds advanced again, the Iraqis opened up. (on camera): Now we're hearing the boom of Iraqi guns as they fire towards our positions.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-2" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="N" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: All morning, the Kurds have been trying to advance, and that was the shell going off. (voice-over): The Iraqi gunners rapidly found our range, and we took refuge in an abandoned farm house . UNIDENTIFIED MALE Get down.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-2" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="N" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Get down!
MANYON We finally managed to get out by car.
Here in the north, Iraqi tanks and guns are still firing, and the American effort is looking a little ragged.
column2: American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-12" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-2" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="N" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Julian Manyon, ITV News, on the northern front. (END VIDEOTAPE) WOODRUFF Julian Manyon with some very dramatic pictures as we look at the live pictures of Baghdad at night.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:20032588" id="Pl-23" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: We will take a short break, our live coverage continues.
American  Troops Capture Saddam Hussein's Main Palace
column2: American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-1" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Letter writing, you know, is sometimes called a lost art in this age of electronic communication.
But it is being rediscovered by U.S. troops in Iraq , at least some of them.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-7" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-11" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Karl Penhaul is with an Army attack helicopter battalion in the town of Najaf in southeastern Iraq . (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) KARL PENHAUL, CNN CORRESPONDENT (voice-over) War, soldiers say, is long hours of boredom, followed by a few moments of madness.
column2: Najaf PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897127" id="Pl-12" latLong="31.992°N 44.351°E" state="NA" type="PPLA",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-11" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Away from the thick of the action, soldiers' minds turn to family, friends and lovers.
No phones, no e-mail, letters are the only link to home.
Melony Marshall was married just a month before she left for Iraq .
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-11" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: PFC MELONY MARSHALL, U.S. ARMY "Hi, sweetheart.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-7" type="COUNTRY"

column1: How you doing?
I haven't received mail in two days.
Being out here in the heat, it is so exhausting.
My love for you grows stronger every day.
The tent, I have to come home to seven people that, they are not so bad half the time.
But, sometimes, you need time away from people.
I miss you more and more.
I'm ready to come home.
When I get home, I don't want to see a camera.
I don't want to see a band.
I don't want to see a formation.
I just want to come home."
PENHAUL Attack pilot John Davis is feeling sad he's missing seeing his children grow up.
CWO JOHN DAVIS, U.S. ARMY "Dear Keegan (ph), Britney (ph) and Josh (ph), I'm doing fine, as is the rest of the battalion.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-7" type="COUNTRY"

column1: I really miss you guys a lot.
And I can hardly wait for the day I can be with you again.
In hindsight, I look back and see plenty of opportunities which I could have used to be a better father, but yet let slip by.
It's unfortunate that it's taken yet another separation from you for me to realize this.
Perhaps I can do better when I get home."
PENHAUL Tiffany O'Neal, a military cook, vents her frustration about the rigors of desert warfare to a friend.
PFC TIFFANY O'NEAL, U.S. ARMY "Hey, Ashley (ph), how you doing?
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-7" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Me, I'm hot as hell out here.
For the last two nights, we woke up to put our gas masks on for no reason.
Our little section gets the information last, or the best we can get.
I guess nobody cared enough to inform the cooks."
PENHAUL In his previous letter home, Apache pilot Joe Bruhl didn't tell his family the full details about his first combat mission.
Now he's trying to set the record straight.
1ST LT.
JOE BRUHL, U.S. ARMY "In my previous letter, written less than two days removed, I only wanted to convey my safety.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-7" type="COUNTRY"

column1: We did receive heavy fire and many of our aircraft took significant hits, including mine.
I tell you all this not to worry you, but to give you comfort knowing what you hear and see is true and that, despite that, I am safe and will continue to be.
PENHAUL (on camera) Different ranks, different anxieties, but all are hoping, by the time their letters get back to the U.S. , they too will soon be heading home.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-7" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Karl Penhaul, for CNN, An Najaf , Iraq . (END VIDEOTAPE) WOODRUFF Very poignant.
column2: Najaf PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897127" id="Pl-12" latLong="31.992°N 44.351°E" state="NA" type="PPLA",An Najaf PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897127" id="Pl-13" latLong="31.992°N 44.351°E" state="NA" type="PPLA",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-11" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: And I bet that father is a better father than he gives himself credit for being.
That's it for this special edition of INSIDE POLITICS.
I'm Judy Woodruff.
null

And, as we listened to John King's report, we can tell you that President Bush has just -- his plane has just landed at Andrews Air Force Base , just SIGNAL id="S-1" close to SIGNAL the Washington area, the president having flown back to the United States from that meeting in Northern Ireland in Belfast with the British prime minister, Tony Blair.
column2: United States PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-2" type="COUNTRY", ,Washington PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:532871" id="Pl-1" latLong="38.895°N 77.037°W" state="US-DC" type="RGN",British PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17389505" id="Pl-6" latLong="54.000°N 4.000°W" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Belfast PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17410393" id="Pl-4" latLong="54.583°N 5.933°W" state="GB-NIR" type="PPLA",Northern Ireland PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17395725" id="Pl-13" latLong="54.500°N 6.500°W" state="GB-NIR" type="CIVIL"

column1: You just heard John reporting about it.
They primarily talked about the war in Iraq , the aftermath of Iraq .
column2: ,Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: But they also discussed the Middle East and, as well, getting the Northern Ireland peace process started up again.
column2: ,Northern Ireland PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17395725" id="Pl-13" latLong="54.500°N 6.500°W" state="GB-NIR" type="CIVIL"

column1: It has been said that Saddam Hussein ruled Iraq with an iron fist.
column2: ,Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: I guess you can say in the past tense.
His regime has left behind some disturbing evidence to support those claims.
The abandoned secret police headquarters in Basra is just one example.
column2: ,Basra PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897821" id="Pl-18" latLong="30.494°N 47.819°E" state="IQ-BA" type="PPLA"

column1: ITN's Bill Neely is with the Royal Marines and he takes us on a tour of Basra 's chamber of horrors . (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) BILL NEELY, ITN REPORTER (voice-over) Saddam Hussein's Iraq is a state of terror, and this is where it's planned and perpetrated, the headquarters of his secret police, this one in Basra .
column2: ,chamber of horrors PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-387" state="IQ-BA" type="FAC",Basra PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897821" id="Pl-18" latLong="30.494°N 47.819°E" state="IQ-BA" type="PPLA",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: No British soldier has been here yet.
column2: ,British PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17389505" id="Pl-6" latLong="54.000°N 4.000°W" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Today, as I walked in, I met Iraqis, none of whom had ever been inside willingly.
column2: ,Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: What was to follow was a horrific education in terror and torture: in the smoking basement of the bombed building , a warren of cells.
Here, prisoners were tortured.
UNIDENTIFIED MALE Yes, of course.
NEELY People died.
UNIDENTIFIED MALE People died, people in prison without court, without trial.
NEELY Any people who Saddam did not like.
UNIDENTIFIED MALE Of course.
Of course.
NEELY (voice-over) The building is crumbling.
Down we went, further to cells that had no light, little air, cockroaches, filth, and, on the ground, a gas mask and bottles of chemicals.
UNIDENTIFIED MALE You can imagine this every day, every month.
So many people come here, but we don't know about them at all.
NEELY These ordinary Iraqis had been terrified to come here, until today, though one student on the left had been here before.
column2: ,Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: UNIDENTIFIED MALE He was one of the prisoners here. (on camera): For how long?
UNIDENTIFIED MALE Eight years.
UNIDENTIFIED MALE Eight, nine, eight years.
NEELY (voice-over) And his crime for eight years in jail?
He prayed too much and was seen as a dangerous radical. (on camera): More cells. (voice-over): But the Mukhabarat headquarters had more horrors to reveal.
UNIDENTIFIED MALE And they tied their hands behind and hung them and hung them for many days.
NEELY These men had relatives murdered here.
So desperate are they to tell their story that they began reenacting what they and their brothers and friends have suffered.
The hook in the ceiling is for one purpose only, another hook in a different cell and a different form of torture.
Saddam Hussein controlled Iraq through fear, torture and execution.
column2: ,Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: And it happened here to tens of thousands of Iraqis that Saddam's secret police deemed dangerous.
column2: ,Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: This man cowered for months, crammed with 300 mothers into a huge cell.
Hamid Fatil (ph) may look like he's acting, but he was tortured here, along with his two brothers, who were executed.
This man was here, too, with his brother.
UNIDENTIFIED MALE They sentenced him to death.
And they sent him to Baghdad and killed.
column2: ,Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-20" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: He was hanged there, hanged.
UNIDENTIFIED MALE There's a prisoner under the name of Ahmed Adis Aeid (ph).

NEELY They kept records of prisoners, these and their fingerprints all that's left of them, apart from the photographs they took of exactly what they had done. (on camera): If there is an evil center to Saddam Hussein's regime, then it is surely here and in other places of torture.
And there's plenty here that we simply cannot show you.
In this block , it was men over here, hundreds of them, and women and children here. (voice-over): To call all this a chamber of horrors is a cliche.
column2: ,chamber of horrors PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-387" state="IQ-BA" type="FAC"

column1: And this place is beyond cliche.
The hundreds or thousands who died here who were given no trial, no voice, cry out.
On the ground, I found a book called "The Psychology of Interrogation," as if the men who worked here for Saddam needed a handbook.
I was glad of the fresh air and glad to leave, glad I could.
No one knows yet whether the new Iraq will be the kind of place where these children can grow up free of the fear, the horror of torture.
column2: ,Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Bill Neely, ITV News, Basra . (END VIDEOTAPE) WOODRUFF Unspeakable.
column2: ,Basra PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897821" id="Pl-18" latLong="30.494°N 47.819°E" state="IQ-BA" type="PPLA"

column1: Journalists killed in the line of duty in Baghdad -- how neutral are reporters in a war supposed to be?
column2: ,Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-20" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: Our Jeff Greenfield examines that question when we come back.
null
Well, the journalists' death raise questions about the tactics of U.S. troops trying to take control of Baghdad .
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:20032588" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-10" type="COUNTRY"

column1: They also serve as a reminder that many of our colleagues covering this war are putting their lives on the line every day.
Some thoughts now on the dangers from our senior analyst, Jeff Greenfield.
(BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) JEFF GREENFIELD, CNN SR. ANALYST (voice-over) When an Al- Jazeera reporter was killed today, the network charged it had been targeted by U.S. force.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-10" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Central Command said, no, its forces were trading fire from a hotel where the network was housed.
At a nearby hotel, two other journalists, a photographer from Reuters and another from Tele 5 Spain died, another case, CENTCOM says, of coalition forces returning fire.
column2: Spain PLACE country="ES" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19596523" id="Pl-15" latLong="40.000°N 4.000°W" type="COUNTRY"

column1: A Kurdish journalist died in a U.S. friendly-fire accident in the north .
column2: north PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-17" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" mod="N" type="COUNTRY",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-10" type="COUNTRY"

column1: And an American writer editor, " Washington Post" editorial columnist Michael Kelly, was killed when his Humvee plunged into a canal while evading Iraqi fire.
column2: Washington PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:532871" id="Pl-18" latLong="38.895°N 77.037°W" state="DC" type="PPLC",American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-9" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-5" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-1" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: (on camera): It is an elementary fact of life during wartime: A press pass provides no protection. (voice-over): Famed World War II reporter Ernie Pyle was killed by a sniper on an island in the Pacific .
Famed combat photographer Robert Capa, who took a classic photo of a fighter's death during the Spanish Civil War, himself died from a land mine in Indochina .
column2: Spanish PLACE country="ES" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19596523" id="Pl-21" latLong="40.000°N 4.000°W" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Sean Flynn, son of the famous actor Errol Flynn, disappeared in Cambodia in 1970.
column2: Cambodia PLACE country="KH" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:18976808" id="Pl-24" latLong="13.000°N 105.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: More than 65 journalists of many nationalities died in Southeast Asia .
ABC News producer David Kaplan was killed by sniper fire in the Balkans in 1992.
Sometimes reporters, like "The Wall Street Journal"'s Danny Pearl, die in covering a different kind of war.
Pearl was murdered by terrorists in Pakistan .
column2: Pakistan PLACE country="PK" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17229029" id="Pl-27" latLong="30.000°N 70.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: The casualty count helps put the ongoing debate about journalistic neutrality into a sharper light.
The 600 journalists embedded with American troops in Iraq will be threatened by the same fire as the troops they are covering.
column2: American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-9" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-5" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Their safety, their lives, may depend on those troops.
Neutrality in a firefight?
Not likely.
And that raises a bigger question.
Are they supposed to be neutral on the outcome of the war?
In an interview with broadcasting and cable magazine, CBS News President Andrew Heyward said of the neutrality notion -- quote -- "It's one of the stupidest things I've ever heard.
This story is going to be told from a U.S. point of view.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-10" type="COUNTRY"

column1: We are American reporters, the ones with the troops." (on camera): Now, none of this means journalists will ignore unsettling news: military setbacks, lack of supplies, the infliction of civilian casualties.
column2: American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-9" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Reporters who ignore or distort facts are betraying their craft no matter what and no matter how much that may anger the people running a war.
But whether in the old Soviet Union or Nazi Germany or South Africa or Iraq , respect for the facts does not require a reporter to throw his values over the side.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-5" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",South Africa PLACE country="ZA" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:18714703" id="Pl-30" latLong="30.000°S 26.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Soviet Union PLACE country="OTHER" form="NAM" id="Pl-28" type="COUNTRY",Germany PLACE country="DE" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:18224345" id="Pl-29" latLong="51.500°N 10.500°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Jeff Greenfield, CNN, New York . (END VIDEOTAPE) WOODRUFF And tonight on "LARRY KING LIVE," Al-Jazeera correspondent Omar Al Issawi will talk to Larry about the death of his colleague and the continuing plight of journalists in a war zone.
column2: New York PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:976772" id="Pl-31" latLong="40.714°N 74.006°W" state="NY" type="PPL"

column1: That's tonight at 9:00 p.
m. p.m.
Eastern, 6:00 Pacific.

Just now, we want to show you scenes from Andrews Air Force Base just moments ago, President Bush returning to the United States from his summit in Northern Ireland in Belfast with British Prime Minister Tony Blair, the president back on American soil after a quick two-day trip, less than two-day trip to Belfast , he and the prime minister discussing, of course, the war in Iraq , what happens after, as well as the peace process in the Middle East , and restarting the peace process in Northern Ireland .
column2: United States PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-32" type="COUNTRY",American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-9" type="COUNTRY",British PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17389505" id="Pl-35" latLong="54.000°N 4.000°W" type="COUNTRY",Belfast PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17410393" id="Pl-36" latLong="54.583°N 5.933°W" state="NIR" type="PPLA",Northern Ireland PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17395725" id="Pl-37" latLong="54.500°N 6.500°W" nonLocUse="true" state="NIR" type="CIVIL",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-5" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: The president then climbed aboard Marine One, the helicopter, heading back to the White House, where he will arrive pretty soon.
Still ahead: How is the world reacting to the war in Iraq ?
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-5" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: When we return, our Richard Quest takes a look.
Stay with us.
U.S.  Forces Hunt for Last of Saddam's Loyal Fighters
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-1" type="COUNTRY"

column1: You are looking at live pictures of the White House where President Bush watched some of the television coverage of events in Baghdad today.
column2: ,Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-13" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC"

column1: Separately, Vice President Cheney shared his thoughts in a speech in New Orleans .
column2: ,New Orleans PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:1630985" id="Pl-26" latLong="29.954°N 90.075°W" state="LA" type="PPL"

column1: With me now for more on all this, CNN's senior White House correspondent John King.
John, they have to be happy there.
JOHN KING, CNN SNR.
WHITE HOUSE CORRESPONDENT Judy, they are.

Behind the scenes privately here you get a palpable sense of vindication, although publicly caution is the watchword here, administration officials from the vice president on down saying the war is not over yet.
Some of the toughest fighting could still be ahead.
Mostly they believe in those northern Iraq areas Brent Sadler was just talking about before the break.
column2: ,Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-24" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: But they do believe the pictures out of Baghdad today, on the one hand, send as powerful a message as you can send to the people in the Arab world who have criticized this war.
column2: ,Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-13" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC"

column1: People in Baghdad celebrating.
column2: ,Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-13" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC"

column1: U.S. troops assisting in pulling down that statue of Saddam Hussein.
column2: ,U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-3" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Across the Arab world, the administration hopes to send a signal that the United States is there to help the Iraqi people regain control of their own country , as a liberty, not as any imperial or occupying force.
column2: United States PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-6" type="COUNTRY", ,Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-24" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",country PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-20" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-23" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Of course, at the same time, though, the White House worries that the American people might see these pictures and think the war is over.
column2: ,American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-9" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Defense Secretary Rumsfeld and Vice President Cheney among those saying the toughest fighting might still lie ahead, still unanswered questions about the whereabouts of Saddam Hussein and other key members of the Iraqi leadership.
column2: ,Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-24" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-23" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: The vice president made that argument today.
But even as he sounds that note of caution, you do sense a little tiny bit of we told you so.

(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP) DICK CHENEY, VICE PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES Bottom line, with less than half of the ground forces and two-thirds of the air assets used 12 years ago in Desert Storm, Secretary Rumsfeld and General Franks have achieved a far more difficult objective.
column2: ,UNITED STATES PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-5" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Yet until this war is fully won, we cannot be overconfident in our position.
And we must not underestimate the desperation of whatever forces remain loyal to the dictator.

(END VIDEO CLIP) KING We will not hear from the president today, we are told, but before the week is out and perhaps as early as tomorrow officials say the president is likely to offer his thoughts on the challenges just ahead.
So, again, behind the scenes, a sense of vindication, but also a cautious attitude because of the fighting still to come.
I have to tell you, though, Judy, the CIA Director George Tenet walked out of the White House a short time ago with a giant smile on his face.
I cannot recall a moment since September 11, 2001 and those tragic events when we have seen the CIA director look so happy.
WOODRUFF Well, John, given all that you've said, we know that there's an American retired general waiting in Kuwait .
column2: ,American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-9" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Kuwait PLACE country="KW" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19210228" id="Pl-27" latLong="29.500°N 47.750°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: But in addition to that, what steps are they already taking at the White House to plan for a post-Saddam Hussein government in Iraq ?
column2: ,Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-24" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: KING They are planning to accelerate that planning process.
Jay Garner the retired general will go into Iraq soon with his troops soon.
column2: ,Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-24" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: I say troops.
They are civilians from the U.S. government.
column2: ,U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-3" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: That will take place soon.
They are awaiting for word from the Pentagon that it believes the security environment is secure enough for that to happen.
And beginning as early as next week, there will be a series of town meetings, if you will.
The invitations will be issued by General Tommy Franks.

They are trying to identify Iraqis from within the country , as well as Iraqi dissidents and exiles, the diaspora they call it here at the White House , who will be part of a planning process to begin the process -- they say it could takes weeks or more -- of selecting who should be part of that interim Iraqi authority.
column2: ,Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-24" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",country PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-20" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-23" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Now, we know, one person who will be invited is planning process, those planning meetings, is Ahmed Chalabi.
He is the leader of the Iraqi National Congress.
column2: ,Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-24" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-23" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: He is known to be a favorite of Vice President Dick Cheney, of Defense Secretary Rumsfeld and Secretary Rumsfeld's top deputy, Paul Wolfowitz.
He will be involved in the planning and in those meetings.

But I also should report that there is a sense of annoyance here at the White House , even among some of Mr. Chalabi's top supporters, that, since returning to Iraq in recent days, he has complained frequently, including on our air earlier today, that the United States is moving too slowly to get in the reconstruction efforts, to restore electricity and restore water.
column2: United States PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-6" type="COUNTRY", ,Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-24" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Over at the Pentagon today, Defense Secretary Rumsfeld, again, a supporter of Mr. Chalabi, said that, in his view, services were already at their prewar levels.
And Mr. Rumsfeld went on to say, Secretary Rumsfeld went on to say, there is still a war going on, still quite a dangerous situation -- Judy.
WOODRUFF Yes, we caught some of that irritation in his choice.
All right, John King, our senior White House correspondent, thank you.
Still to come: warfare amid the celebrations in Baghdad .
column2: ,Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-13" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC"

column1: As Iraqis poured into the streets to mark their apparent new freedom, American troops come under fire from a different area.
column2: ,American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-9" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-24" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-23" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: CNN's Martin Savidge will show us what they came up against at Baghdad University . (NEWS BREAK)
column2: ,Baghdad University PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-14" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC",Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-13" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC"

column1: U.S.  Forces Hunt for Last of Saddam's Loyal Fighters
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-1" type="COUNTRY"

column1: The United States Navy and Coast Guard crews are providing port security in the Persian Gulf during the Iraq war.
column2: United States PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-4" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-13" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: And one group of sailors is getting letters from elementary school children in North Carolina .
column2: North Carolina PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:1028616" id="Pl-9" latLong="35.501°N 80.001°W" state="NC" type="CIVIL"

column1: The students are getting inspiration from their teacher, who has a personal connection, as CNN's Daryn Kagan reports.

(BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) DARYN KAGAN, CNN CORRESPONDENT (voice-over) It started as a story on port security, how U.S. Navy and Coast Guard reserves are keeping ships safe from attack in Kuwait and Iraq . (on camera): The mission of these units is to protect these ports. (voice-over): But among the boats, guns, radar, sonar and communications, we found a secret weapon posted on the side of the tent that serves as the command center: letters from second-graders.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-3" type="COUNTRY",Kuwait PLACE country="KW" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19210228" id="Pl-17" latLong="29.500°N 47.750°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-13" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Each one starts the same way.
UNIDENTIFIED MALE "Dear brave friend."
UNIDENTIFIED MALE "Dear brave friend."
LT. CMDR.
MIKE ROBERTS, U.S. NAVY "Dear brave friend.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-3" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Hello.
My name is Ryan.
I am in second grade.
You are keeping the United States of America safe.
column2: United States PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-4" type="COUNTRY",United States of America PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-5" type="COUNTRY"

column1: You are..." UNIDENTIFIED MALE "You are my best friend.
You can keep this in your bag.
Sincerely, Ryan." ROBERTS I'm the big brother.
KAGAN It turns out this is actually a story about a brother, Lieutenant Commander Mike Roberts, and a supportive sister, Christine Cupolo.
CHRISTINE CUPOLO, TEACHER Yes, I do.
My brother is in Kuwait .
column2: Kuwait PLACE country="KW" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19210228" id="Pl-17" latLong="29.500°N 47.750°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: ROBERTS My sister is a grammar school teacher in Clayton , North Carolina .
column2: North Carolina PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:1028616" id="Pl-9" latLong="35.501°N 80.001°W" state="NC" type="CIVIL",Clayton PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:1020689" id="Pl-10" latLong="35.651°N 78.457°W" state="NC" type="PPL"

column1: CUPOLO He was sent over right next to the Persian Gulf now since New Year's Eve.
And this is one of many deployments he's been on, but this one is probably the most crucial.
ROBERTS Her second-graders were very interested in sending some letters out to the troops.
CUPOLO So, I knew that, at one point or another, my children needed to write.
I thought that would be a real uplifting experience for the troops.
ROBERTS And she says: "Dear brave friend.
Hello.
My name is Amanda." UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE "We would have to say that you are a very brave person.
When the war starts, your heart will be in our souls."
ROBERTS For these kids to takes time to read letters to us and stuff like that in their class, what more can you ask?
Just keep it going.
KAGAN There will be more letters on the way.
Back in North Carolina , the Riverwood Elementary second-graders are working on the next batch.
column2: North Carolina PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:1028616" id="Pl-9" latLong="35.501°N 80.001°W" state="NC" type="CIVIL"

column1: CUPOLO Absolutely.
You might want to mention that in your letter as well.
KAGAN This time, they hope the sailors will write back with answers to their questions.
CUPOLO So you want to know how fast the dolphins there are swimming?
OK.
I would write that down.
I would say: "Dear, friend, I have some questions for you.
I want to know about the dolphins that are helping you out over there."
Can you do that?
Do you think you could ask them a question?
Sure.
They will be happy to answer it.
We started work on our letters the last week of February and worked on them the first week of March and sent them out a few weeks ago.
And they got the letters pretty quickly over there.
But I think this helps me stay closer to my brother.
KAGAN (on camera) Any message to your sister?
ROBERTS Yes.
I'd just like to tell her, thank you very much, Christine.
Hope you're doing well in North Carolina .
column2: North Carolina PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:1028616" id="Pl-9" latLong="35.501°N 80.001°W" state="NC" type="CIVIL"

column1: And thank you very much to your students for all the support and the letters that they sent out to us.
KAGAN (voice-over) Their second-grade work keeping watch over those who keep watch in the Persian Gulf .
Daryn Kagan, CNN, Kuwait . (END VIDEOTAPE) WOODRUFF Those letters important at both ends.
column2: Kuwait PLACE country="KW" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19210228" id="Pl-17" latLong="29.500°N 47.750°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: That's it for this hour.
I'm Judy Woodruff in Washington .
column2: Washington PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:532871" id="Pl-20" latLong="38.895°N 77.037°W" state="DC" type="PPLC"

column1: Saddam Hussein is Losing Grip on Northern Cities in Iraq
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-3" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: WOODRUFF Yesterday, there were scenes of jubilation in Baghdad , today, a suicide bombing and firefighters, grim reminders that, as U.S. Central Command put it, Baghdad is still an ugly place.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-2" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",place PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-83" state="IQ-BG" type="FAC"

column1: CNN's John Irvine has this profile of a city literally teetering on a razor's edge.
column2: city PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-10" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) JOHN IRVINE, CNN CORRESPONDENT (voice-over) Getting acquainted, very deliberately, the U.S. Marines are trying to strike up a rapport with the people who are now their responsibility.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-2" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: But there are still problems bringing control to Baghdad , particularly at nighttime.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: In the pitch black of a city without power, these soldiers manning a roadblock became nervous.
column2: city PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-10" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",roadblock PLACE country="IE" form="NOM" id="Pl-77" state="IQ-BG" type="FAC"

column1: UNIDENTIFIED MALE Stay the (EXPLETIVE DELETED) back!
Back up!
IRVINE When a car fails to stop, it's the cue for a violent gun battle.
Bullets are sprayed everywhere.
In parts of Baghdad that the Americans haven't yet reached, there has been looting.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: This man took the horse from a stable at the home of Uday Hussein, Saddam's eldest son.
column2: home PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-88" state="IQ-BG" type="FAC"

column1: We found the house , a large, gaudy structure , a place that just a few days ago people didn't even look at for fear of their lives.
column2: structure PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-80" state="IQ-BG" type="FAC",house PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-82" state="IQ-BG" type="FAC",place PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-83" state="IQ-BG" type="FAC"

column1: This indeed was one of Uday's homes.
column2: home PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-88" state="IQ-BG" type="FAC"

column1: Here, the ruling family could look out over the Tigris .
column2: Tigris PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16895173" id="Pl-11" latLong="31.000°N 47.417°E" type="WATER"

column1: People have wasted no time clearing the house and wrecking what couldn't be easily taken. (on camera): They haven't quite worked out just how to reach this will chandelier yet.
column2: house PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-82" state="IQ-BG" type="FAC"

column1: But, other than that, they have stripped this place bare in less than 24 hours.
column2: place PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-83" state="IQ-BG" type="FAC"

column1: Call it plunder, if you will, or perhaps payback. (voice-over): These Iraqis were rifling a home of a senior member of the Mukhabarat, Saddam's dreaded secret police.
column2: home PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-88" state="IQ-BG" type="FAC"

column1: It also seemed to be some kind of monitoring station .
There was sophisticated equipment here.
In the basement , we found burning archives and evidence of electronic surveillance.
column2: basement PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-96" state="IQ-BG" type="FAC"

column1: This had been a nerve center for spying, a place from where the bully boys kept tabs to keep control. (on camera): We're now in the bowels of a secret police monitoring station . Look at all this gadgetry, quite sinister really, part of the apparatus of Big Brother. (voice-over): These people are stealing from a shopping center .
column2: shopping center PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-98" state="IQ-BG" type="FAC",place PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-83" state="IQ-BG" type="FAC"

column1: It has become widespread, but it's not being done with total impunity.
These thieves are trying to flee the German Embassy , having been shot at by a guard.
column2: Embassy PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" id="Pl-99" state="IQ-BG" type="FAC",German PLACE country="DE" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:18224345" id="Pl-12" latLong="51.500°N 10.500°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: John Irvine, ITV News, Baghdad . (END VIDEOTAPE)
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: Saddam Hussein is Losing Grip on Northern Cities in Iraq
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-1" latLong="33.000Â°N 44.000Â°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Some pictures.
Well, Laith Kubba is an Iraqi exile who has family members in Iraq .
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-20" latLong="33.000Â°N 44.000Â°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-19" latLong="33.000Â°N 44.000Â°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Mr. Kubba is a senior fellow at a think tank called the National Endowment for Democracy.
He is also the president of a group of Iraqi exiles, a group called the Iraq National Group.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-20" latLong="33.000Â°N 44.000Â°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-19" latLong="33.000Â°N 44.000Â°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: He joins us now from London to talk about rebuilding his country .
column2: London PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17398111" id="Pl-29" latLong="51.500Â°N 0.117Â°W" state="GB-ENG" type="PPLC",country PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-23" latLong="33.000Â°N 44.000Â°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Mr. Kubba, first of all, your thoughts as you've watched these scenes of Baghdad , the Saddam Hussein regime falling in the last day?
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-28" latLong="33.339Â°N 44.394Â°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: LAITH KUBBA, PRESIDENT, IRAQI NATIONAL GROUP It is a huge sigh of relief, because it could have been much worse and Baghdad could have been a war theater with more destruction to property.
column2: IRAQI PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-6" latLong="33.000Â°N 44.000Â°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-28" latLong="33.339Â°N 44.394Â°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: And, obviously, there are four million people who could have suffered more.
So, there is a sigh of relief that it is not worse.
But, obviously, there is a great, great concern about the scenes that you've been showing on television.
WOODRUFF Are you talking to family members now in Baghdad and around Iraq ?
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-28" latLong="33.339Â°N 44.394Â°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-20" latLong="33.000Â°N 44.000Â°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: And, if you are, how concerned are they about the lawlessness?
KUBBA Well, not in the recent three or four days.
There are no phone lines to Baghdad .
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-28" latLong="33.339Â°N 44.394Â°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: In other parts of Iraq , I received with great sadness the killing of one close colleague, Saeed Abu Naji Abhuey (ph) in Najaf .
column2: Najaf PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897127" id="Pl-32" latLong="31.992Â°N 44.351Â°E" state="IQ-NA" type="PPLA",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-20" latLong="33.000Â°N 44.000Â°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: He was not killed by former members of the Baath Party or the security of the army, but by just a local organized group.
So those signs to me are worrying.
People are sensing and feeling the lack of authority or the power vacuum and are testing it.
And the more they test, the more I think they are claiming.
WOODRUFF How difficult will it be to sort out who will next hold power in Iraq after this transition period, however long it is, where the U.S. is in charge?
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-35" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-20" latLong="33.000Â°N 44.000Â°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: KUBBA Well, one needs to break down this process into various elements.
Today, there should be an authority.
And it's very likely that the U.S. and the British forces are the authority on land.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-35" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",British PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17389505" id="Pl-31" latLong="54.000Â°N 4.000Â°W" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: And there ought to be administration.
And this ought to be primarily by Iraqis.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-20" latLong="33.000Â°N 44.000Â°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-19" latLong="33.000Â°N 44.000Â°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: But when it comes to government, I think we really need to map out step by step how to move from this power vacuum to the day we have elections.
We need to involve the U.N. We need to involve all Iraqi forces in the country , outside the country .
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-20" latLong="33.000Â°N 44.000Â°E" type="COUNTRY",country PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-23" latLong="33.000Â°N 44.000Â°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-19" latLong="33.000Â°N 44.000Â°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: But we need to do it quickly, because every day passes by with this vacuum, it's going to spell trouble.
WOODRUFF Well, we know, Mr. Kubba, there are several Iraqi exiles groups competing for influence.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-20" latLong="33.000Â°N 44.000Â°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-19" latLong="33.000Â°N 44.000Â°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Is one of them going to have an advantage?
And, particularly, I have in mind the Iraqi National Congress that Mr. Chalabi, who was assisted by U.S. forces in getting back into Iraq ?
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-35" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-20" latLong="33.000Â°N 44.000Â°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-19" latLong="33.000Â°N 44.000Â°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: KUBBA I think it's one thing to gain fame and access to Washington .
column2: Washington PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:532871" id="Pl-39" latLong="38.895Â°N 77.037Â°W" state="US-DC" type="PPLC"

column1: It's totally another to gain legitimacy and functioning grounds inside Iraq .
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-20" latLong="33.000Â°N 44.000Â°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: And I think plans must not be drawn in thin air out in Washington .
column2: Washington PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:532871" id="Pl-39" latLong="38.895Â°N 77.037Â°W" state="US-DC" type="PPLC"

column1: It must really be drawn on the ground inside Iraq .
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-20" latLong="33.000Â°N 44.000Â°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: And there are 22 million people there.
It's not a void.
It's not a vacuum.
And I think all plans must be anchored there in Iraq in its reality.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-20" latLong="33.000Â°N 44.000Â°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: WOODRUFF So does one group have an advantage over another now?

KUBBA There are different groups who have advantage over others in different parts of the country . Unfortunately, we do not have a national group that can appeal to Iraqis as Iraqis within a credible voice.This needs to be constructed, maybe through a conference to be held in Baghdad , where representatives from provinces all over Iraq need to participate, as well as political groups.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-28" latLong="33.339Â°N 44.394Â°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-20" latLong="33.000Â°N 44.000Â°E" type="COUNTRY",country PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-23" latLong="33.000Â°N 44.000Â°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-19" latLong="33.000Â°N 44.000Â°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: But we do not have a single group, a single leadership or a single council yet.
WOODRUFF We're talking with Laith Kubba, who is the president of a group of Iraqi exiles.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-20" latLong="33.000Â°N 44.000Â°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-19" latLong="33.000Â°N 44.000Â°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: The group is called the Iraq National Group.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-20" latLong="33.000Â°N 44.000Â°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Mr. Kubba, we thank you so much for talking to us from London .
column2: London PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17398111" id="Pl-29" latLong="51.500Â°N 0.117Â°W" state="GB-ENG" type="PPLC"

column1: KUBBA Thank you.
WOODRUFF We appreciate it.
KUBBA Thank you.
WOODRUFF Here in Washington , members of the House of Representatives come together to support America 's armed forces.
column2: America PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-36" type="COUNTRY",Washington PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:532871" id="Pl-39" latLong="38.895Â°N 77.037Â°W" state="US-DC" type="PPLC"

column1: Up next: a live report on that ceremony and the latest efforts to pass a spending bill to pay for the war.
Lynch Travels Back to U.S.  ; Is Life in Iraq  Stabilizing?; Is Bush
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-1" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-5" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: WOODRUFF A reminder, Jessica Lynch coming back to the United States within the hour.
column2: United States PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-24" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Tonight, a special on the rescue of Jessica Lynch.
That's at 8:30 p.m. Eastern , 5:30 Pacific .
column2: Eastern PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-25" mod="E" type="COUNTRY",Pacific PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-26" mod="W" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Well, after many trying months of defending Saddam Hussein, Ambassador Mohammed Aldouri finally said the game is over.
Now, his tenure at the United Nations is over, too.
Last night before leaving the United States , Aldouri said he hopes to see free elections in a free Iraq .
column2: United States PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-24" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-18" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: CNN's Richard Roth has more on this once prominent frontman for the Iraqi regime.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-18" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) RICHARD ROTH, CNN SENIOR U.N. CORRESPONDENT (voice-over) The last time Iraqi 's U.N. ambassador addressed the Security Council, the U.S. ambassador walked out in protest.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-18" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-4" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: MOHAMMED ALDOURI, IRAQI AMBASSADOR TO U.N. (through translator) What happened is that the Iraqi army up until now has not confronted the United States forces.
column2: United States PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-24" type="COUNTRY",IRAQI PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-18" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: ROTH But now, it's the Iraqi ambassador's time to leave, the United States .
column2: United States PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-24" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-18" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: ALDOURI The game is over.
I hope that peace will prevail, and that the Iraqi people at the end of the day will have a peaceful life.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-18" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: ROTH Mohammed Aldouri spent more years as a university professor than as a diplomat.
In New York , he briefed people interested in his country , recently a group of Lehigh University students.
column2: country PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-30" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",New York PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:976772" id="Pl-40" latLong="40.714°N 74.006°We" state="NY" type="PPL"

column1: But he never got comfortable in the media glare before and especially during the war.
UNIDENTIFIED MALE You said you weren't.
.. weren't..
. weren't...
ALDOURI (UNINTELLIGIBLE) has happened with you?
Please, why did you come here?
UNIDENTIFIED MALE Because we thought.
.. thought..
. thought...
ALDOURI Tomorrow, I will see you in the U.N. ROTH And at the U.N., all ambassadors carry out their instructions whether they agree with them or not.
JUAN GABRIEL VALDES, CHILEAN AMBASSADOR TO U.S. Well, I think that he had a very, very difficult task.
column2: CHILEAN PLACE country="CL" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19123076" id="Pl-31" latLong="30.000°S 71.000°W" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-4" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: He defended the positions of his country with courage, I would say.
column2: country PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-30" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: JEREMY GREENSTOCK, BRITISH AMBASSADOR TO U.N. He's a decent man, and I hope he finds a decent life representing a decent government.
column2: BRITISH PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17389505" id="Pl-32" latLong="54.000°N 4.000°W" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: UNIDENTIFIED MALE Aldouri is a dear friend of mine.
ROTH Aldouri also drew support from opponents of the war a gift of paper cranes.
But on the eve of Aldouri's departure, women representing the Daughters of the American Revolution passed by, wanting to let fly with something else.
column2: American PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-33" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE If I had eggs, I would like to throw eggs at him.
ROTH U.N. diplomats don't toss eggs, just nods.
Several months ago, the U.S. ambassador, John Negroponte, and the Iraqi ambassador almost locked eyes.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-18" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-4" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: And forget about Kuwait .
column2: Kuwait PLACE country="KW" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19210228" id="Pl-34" latLong="29.500°N 47.750°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: MOHAMMED ABULHASAN, KUWAITI AMBASSADOR TO U.N. Nothing.
column2: KUWAITI PLACE country="KW" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19210228" id="Pl-35" latLong="29.500°N 47.750°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: UNIDENTIFIED MALE Not one word?
ABULHASAN Not one word, except a normal greeting of, "Hello, how are you?"
ROTH That was as close as residents of New York 's Upper East Side district got to know Aldouri, who kept a low profile, like many in the big city .
column2: city PLACE country="US" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:976772" id="Pl-38" latLong="40.714°N 74.006°We" state="NY" type="PPL",New York PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:976772" id="Pl-40" latLong="40.714°N 74.006°We" state="NY" type="PPL"

column1: It's a neighborhood you wouldn't expect the diplomatic post of an enemy government to turn up.
column2: neighborhood PLACE country="US" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:976772" id="Pl-41" latLong="40.714°N 74.006°We" mod="NE" state="NY" type="PPL"

column1: ALDOURI I am very thankful for the people of New York , for their generosity.
column2: New York PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:976772" id="Pl-40" latLong="40.714°N 74.006°We" state="NY" type="PPL"

column1: This is a very decent people.
I was really -- without talking about the problem in Iraq , I was really happy to be here in New York , within the people of New York .
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-18" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",New York PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:976772" id="Pl-40" latLong="40.714°N 74.006°We" state="NY" type="PPL"

column1: ROTH Aldouri was worried most about the people of Iraq .
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-18" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: ALDOURI When I see, what I've seen, what you see, my heart squeezes blood.
ROTH Aldouri was in better spirits as he departed for the airport with a final message.
ALDOURI I hope that the United States Army will leave Iraq soon, and we will have free election for a free government for a free future for Iraq and the people for Iraq .
column2: United States PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-24" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-18" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: This is my message to you, to the people of the United States .
column2: United States PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-24" type="COUNTRY"

column1: ROTH The ambassador's prime concern now: his family in Iraq .
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-18" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: One day he hopes to teach again back home.
Richard Roth, CNN, United Nations . (END VIDEOTAPE) WOODRUFF We'll try to track his progress and see if he's able to do that, Ambassador Aldouri.
Still ahead, looters cast about for new places to loot, and chaos is king in Baghdad .
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-42" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="BG" type="PPLC"

column1: We'll have a report.
Lynch Travels Back to U.S.  ; Is Life in Iraq  Stabilizing?; Is Bush
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-8" type="COUNTRY",Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-5" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: WOODRUFF One of the toughest jobs in Iraq right now is that of the military doctor.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-6" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: CNN medical correspondent, Dr. Sanjay Gupta, has been traveling with the Devil Docs throughout the war and now they are close to Baghdad . (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) SANJAY GUPTA, CNN MEDICAL CORRESPONDENT (voice-over) Each of these bangs and explosions comes with a story.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-4" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" mod="CENTRAL" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: Some we'll never know.
For others, the stories can be seen in their injuries.
Nobody knows these stories better than the Devil Docs, Naval corpsmen who never look the other way, but rather face what needs to be done without flinching.
They are often the first faces the injured see, be they Iraqi or coalition force members.
column2: Iraq PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-6" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" type="COUNTRY",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-7" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Even while statutes were coming down and there was dancing in the streets, the consequences of continuing firefights are seen here.
The work of the Devil Docs is by no means over.
The Navy has set up a helicopter landing zone just a SIGNAL id="S-1" 100 meters SIGNAL from a mobile operating room , just SIGNAL id="S-2" on the outskirts SIGNAL of Baghdad .
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-4" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" mod="CENTRAL" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: This is the closest front line surgical company.
Corpsmen quickly take patients by ambulance away from the blowing sand to a triage tent.
It is there the doctors begin their work.
Over 45 minutes as we watched, 32 patients were delivered here, evaluated and nine operations started; 29 of those delivered, Marines involved in a firefight in the center of Baghdad .
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-4" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" mod="CENTRAL" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: Their stories could be seen in the shrapnel wounds of rocket-propelled grenades and bullet wounds from semi-automatic weapons.
The operations are on their hands, abdomen and face.
Two of the Marines, too far gone.
For many of the survivors, that news is the most difficult to handle.
Along with the medical care, hands are held, spirits are lifted.
Dr. Sanjay Gupta, CNN with the Devil Docs outside Baghdad . (END VIDEOTAPE)
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-4" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" mod="CENTRAL" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: Virtually No Resistance In Tikrit  , Supposedly Place of Saddam's Last
column2: Tikrit PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16888105" id="Pl-9" latLong="34.597°N 43.677°E" state="IQ-SD" type="PPL"

column1: (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) MILES O'BRIEN, CNN CORRESPONDENT (voice-over) The people of Tikrit are saying Saddam's family left that city three days ago, well before the Americans arrived.
column2: Tikrit PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16888105" id="Pl-10" latLong="34.597°N 43.677°E" state="IQ-SD" type="PPL",city PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: Saddam's clan is said to have left for a small village in the desert . 12:19 p.
column2: desert PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-167" type="RGN",village PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" id="Pl-13" type="PPL"

column1: m.: p.m.

: CNN's Ryan Chilcote reports the 101st Airborne 2nd Brigade finds 11 of what an Army general describes as chem-bio labs buried to avoid detection near Karbala , each of the structures 20-by- 20 feet.
column2: Karbala PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16892923" id="Pl-14" latLong="32.250°N 43.117°E" state="IQ-KA" type="PPLA"

column1: And the military also found over 1,000 pounds of documents buried at the site.
U.S. inspections will continue there.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-2" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: (END VIDEOTAPE) WOODRUFF Well, Baghdad is a city where drinking water and working telephones are hot commodities.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-7" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",city PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: Now, regular cell phones rarely work these days in the city , we're told, but satellite phones are another story entirely.
column2: city PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-12" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: CNN's Rula Amin reports from the Iraqi capital . (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) RULA AMIN, CNN CORRESPONDENT (voice-over) They wait for hours to find a journalist and they plead with us to borrow our mobile satellite phones.
column2: capital PLACE country="IQ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-4" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC",Iraqi PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16897518" id="Pl-8" latLong="33.000°N 44.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: They need to send a message to their families abroad just to tell them, "We are alive," says this woman.
Here, they wait outside a restaurant where journalists hang out.
And they are desperate.
Only for one minute, says this mother.
She wants to call her pregnant daughter Saba (ph) in Sweden to see if she has delivered.
column2: Sweden PLACE country="SE" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17462875" id="Pl-15" latLong="62.000°N 15.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: It's not good for her to worry about us, she says.
Across the fence, a 21-year-old U.S. Marine named Jason Cook (ph) is after the same phones.
column2: U.S. PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-2" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: He wants to call his mom in Houston .
column2: Houston PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:1381948" id="Pl-168" latLong="29.763°N 95.363°W" state="US-TX" type="PPL"

column1: A " New York Times" reporter lends Cook his mobile sat phone.
column2: New York PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:976772" id="Pl-16" latLong="40.714°N 74.006°W" state="US-NY" type="PPL"

column1: UNIDENTIFIED MALE I love you too, mom.
Hey, old man.
I'm in the middle of Baghdad , just patrolling up and down the streets.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-7" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: AMIN Cook hasn't spoken to his family since Super Bowl Sunday, January 26.
On this one sidewalk in Baghdad , they were all doing the most natural thing during war, trying to reach their loved ones.
column2: Baghdad PLACE country="IQ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16896419" id="Pl-7" latLong="33.339°N 44.394°E" state="IQ-BG" type="PPLC"

column1: UNIDENTIFIED MALE My mother, brother and sister.
AMIN (on camera) How many do you have?
UNIDENTIFIED MALE I got an older brother and a little brother and sister.
AMIN (voice-over) His mother told him to keep his head down.
UNIDENTIFIED MALE She didn't believe I was really talking to her.
AMIN We do our share.
And the first to call is the mother.
Saba hasn't delivered yet.
Nevertheless, the mother is happy.
Everyone wanted to call.
We couldn't accommodate everybody.
So, on small notes, they wrote the phone numbers we didn't get to dial, hoping we'd deliver on our promise that we'd call on their behalf.
Rula Amin, CNN, Baghdad . (END VIDEOTAPE) WOODRUFF Makes you wish they had enough satellite phones to go around for everybody.
