column1: The Central Jakarta District Court began Wednesday the trial of Muslim cleric Abu Bakar Ba' asyir who has been in custody since last October on charges of treason and immigration offenses.
column2: Central Jakarta PLACE country="ID" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17320348" id="Pl-3" latLong="6.174°S 106.829°E" mod="CENTRAL" state="ID-JK" type="CIVIL"

column1: Ba'asyir, 64, was arrested on preliminary charges of involvement in a series of church bombings on the eve of the 2000 Christmas and an alleged plot to assassinate Megawati Soekarnoputri in 1999, when she was vice president.
He is also charged with immigration offenses for having a Malaysian citizenship since 1993.
column2: Malaysian PLACE country="MY" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17594843" id="Pl-5" latLong="2.500°N 112.500°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Seven prosecutors read in turn the indictment against Ba'asyir at the makeshift court room in the Meteorology and Geophysics Agency's office in Central Jakarta .
column2: office PLACE country="ID" form="NOM" id="Pl-31" type="FAC",Central Jakarta PLACE country="ID" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17320348" id="Pl-3" latLong="6.174°S 106.829°E" mod="CENTRAL" state="ID-JK" type="CIVIL",room PLACE country="ID" form="NOM" id="Pl-29" type="FAC"

column1: The authorities have moved the trial venue for security reasons and to allow wider media coverage.
Ba'asyir was not officially charged with the Bali bombing last October, but police said he gave his blessing to the Bali perpetrators.
column2: Bali PLACE country="ID" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17328626" id="Pl-8" latLong="6.123°S 106.991°E" predicative="true" state="ID-BA" type="CIVIL"

column1: Police believed Ba'asyir was the spiritual leader of Jemaah Islamiyah, the terrorist network in Southeast Asia which is widely blamed for the Bali bombing.
column2: Bali PLACE country="ID" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17328626" id="Pl-8" latLong="6.123°S 106.991°E" predicative="true" state="ID-BA" type="CIVIL"

column1: According to the Criminal Code, treason is punishable with a possible death penalty.
Ba'asyir has publicly denied any wrongdoing and refused to answer police questioning.

column1: Family of wanted Briton over Tel Aviv  bombing remanded in custody
column2: Tel Aviv PLACE country="IL" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19218455" id="Pl-1" latLong="32.067°N 34.767°E" state="TA" type="PPL"

column1: Three family members of British Muslim Omar Sharif, who is wanted for the April 30 suicide bomb attack in Israel , were remanded in custody after appearing in a London court on Friday with charges in connection with the blast.
column2: British PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17389505" id="Pl-11" latLong="54.000°N 4.000°W" type="COUNTRY",Israel PLACE country="IL" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19219725" id="Pl-3" latLong="31.500°N 34.750°E" type="COUNTRY",London PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17398111" id="Pl-9" latLong="51.500°N 0.117°W" state="ENG" type="PPLC"

column1: Sharif's wife Tahari Shad Tabussum, 27, brother Zahid Hussain Sharif, 46, and sister Paveen Sharif, 35, made no application for bail at the court, according to local reports.
All of them were charged Thursday under Section 38 of the Terrorism Act 2000, which covers failure to disclose information about acts of terrorism, said the reports.
The sister was also charged under section 62 of the Terrorism Act which covers aiding and abetting acts of terrorism overseas.
Israeli authorities have claimed Sharif, 27, from Derby , was on the run after failing to blow himself up in the attack on a Tel Aviv bar.
column2: Tel Aviv PLACE country="IL" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19218455" id="Pl-2" latLong="32.067°N 34.767°E" state="TA" type="PPL",Derby PLACE country="GB" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17405738" id="Pl-12" latLong="52.933°N 1.500°W" state="DBY" type="PPL",Israel PLACE country="IL" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19219725" id="Pl-3" latLong="31.500°N 34.750°E" type="COUNTRY",Israeli PLACE country="IL" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19219725" id="Pl-4" latLong="31.500°N 34.750°E" type="COUNTRY"

Colombian  guerrillas urge prisoner swap with gov't
column2: Colombian PLACE country="CO" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19418914" id="Pl-4" latLong="4.000°N 72.000°W" type="COUNTRY"

column1: The Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) said Monday that it was prepared to exchange prisoners with the government despite the death of 10 hostages held by the rebel group.
column2: Colombia PLACE country="CO" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19418914" id="Pl-3" latLong="4.000°N 72.000°W" type="COUNTRY"

column1: The FARC sought the exchange of more than 70 politicians, soldiers and policemen in its control for nearly 500 rebels imprisoned by the government, said Luis Devia, also known as Raul Reyes, a FARC leader, in a letter sent to the program Noticias Uno.
On May 5, 10 hostages held by the FARC were killed during an attempt to rescue them by the army.
The victims were Antioquia Governor Guillermo Gaviria, former Defense Minister Gilberto Echeverry and eight soldiers.
column2: Antioquia PLACE country="CO" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19422672" id="Pl-5" latLong="7.000°N 75.500°W" state="ANT" type="CIVIL"

column1: Reyes said in his letter that the "guerrilla units are in the moral obligation of saving and protecting lives and physical integrity of their prisoners."
The rebels "in any case cannot allow to have its prisoners to be taken away by enemy forces without a military response," he added.
The 17,000-strong FARC, the largest guerrilla force in Colombia , has been fighting a war against the government for more than 40 years, leaving 400,000 dead.
column2: Colombia PLACE country="CO" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19418914" id="Pl-3" latLong="4.000°N 72.000°W" type="COUNTRY"

column1: It is still holding hundreds of hostages including three Americans.
Philippine  government dismisses Estrada still-be-president claim
column2: Philippine PLACE country="PH" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17554385" id="Pl-4" latLong="13.000°N 122.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: The Philippine Presidential Palace Friday dismissed as an "old tune" deposed leader Joseph Estrada's claim that he was still the country 's legitimate president.
column2: Philippine PLACE country="PH" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17554385" id="Pl-3" latLong="13.000°N 122.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",country PLACE country="PH" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:17554385" id="Pl-5" latLong="13.000°N 122.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Presidential Chief of Staff Rigoberto Tiglao said Estrada's camp was trying to revive the issue on the legality of President Gloria Macapagal-Arroyo's administration when this was upheld twice by the Supreme Court.

This is an old tune as far as the Palace is concerned, Tiglao said hours after Estrada petitioned the anti-graft court, the Sandiganbayan, to dismiss the government charges against him, citing "lack of jurisdiction" since he was still the president.

Meanwhile, the court shrugged off the claim of Estrada's lawyer Alan Paguia that its ruling on the legitimacy of the Arroyo administration was illegal and cautioned that the tribunal's decision was final and could not be overturned by the Sandiganbayan.
The Sandiganbayan Special Division Friday reset for June 16 the resumption of Estrada's plunder case hearing, which was originally scheduled for June 2.
Estrada, who was ousted in a military-backed popular revolt in January 2001, has been detained for almost two years at the Veterans Memorial Medical Center in Metro Manila on plunder charges.
column2: Metro Manila PLACE country="PH" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:17560232" id="Pl-2" latLong="14.583°N 121.000°E" state="PH-00" type="CIVIL",Veterans Memorial Medical Center PLACE country="PH" form="NAM" id="Pl-264" type="FAC"

column1: Czech  president appoints new defense minister
column2: Czech PLACE country="CZ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19456509" id="Pl-2" latLong="49.750°N 15.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Czech President Vaclav Klaus on Monday appointed Miroslav Kostelka as the country 's new defense minister to replace Jaroslav Tvrdik who resigned from the post in late May.
column2: Czech PLACE country="CZ" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19456509" id="Pl-3" latLong="49.750°N 15.000°E" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY",country PLACE country="CZ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:19456509" id="Pl-5" latLong="49.750°N 15.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: The decision was made in response to the recommendation of Prime Minister Vladimir Spidla.
Kostelka, 52, was first deputy defense minister and an ex- general.
At the end of last month, Tvrdik submitted his resignation in protest against planned cuts in defense spending as part of the government's finance reforms.
Under the planned package of public finance reforms, only 2.05 percent of the country 's gross domestic product (GDP) will be allocated for the defense budget.
column2: country PLACE country="CZ" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:19456509" id="Pl-5" latLong="49.750°N 15.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Tvrdik said the military reform could not be completed thoroughly with so little money.
Tvrdik, who took over the defense ministry in May 2001, also announced that he would quit his post in the parliament and give up his position in the ruling party Social Democrats.
Prime Minister Spidla said Monday that the ongoing military reform should continue, with regard to the government's planned public finance reforms.
The appointment marked the second change of the cabinet post since the Spidla-led government came into power in July 2002.
US  pharmaceutical company founder sentenced to 87 months in prison
column2: US PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-1" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Sam Waksal, founder of the US pharmaceutical company ImClone Systems was sentenced to 87 months in prison Tuesday for insider trading.
column2: US PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-3" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Waksal was also ordered to pay more than 4 million dollars in fines and back taxes.
This order came after about two hours' legal proceedings at the Manhattan courthouse in New York , according to a TV report.
column2: New York PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:976772" id="Pl-7" latLong="40.714°N 74.006°W" state="US-NY" type="PPL",Manhattan PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:957351" id="Pl-5" latLong="44.352°N 75.917°W" predicative="true" state="US-NY" type="RGN",courthouse PLACE country="US" form="NOM" id="Pl-211" state="US-NY" type="FAC"

column1: Before the sentence, there had been speculations among analysts on whether Waksal would get leniency because his company has been working on researches of cancer drugs, a good endeavor in the eyes of many people.
ImClone's Erbitux drug has been recently accepted to be effective in helping cancer patients.
But the order just released from the courthouse in New York has obviously separated Waksal's good efforts in making new drugs from his legal problems.
column2: New York PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:976772" id="Pl-7" latLong="40.714°N 74.006°W" state="US-NY" type="PPL",courthouse PLACE country="US" form="NOM" id="Pl-211" state="US-NY" type="FAC"

column1: Amid the financial storms last year and the ensuing cracking down on corporate malfeasance, Waksal pleaded guilty in October to charges involving his efforts to sell a huge block of his company' s stock in late 2001.
The attempt to sell the shares were just before ImClone shares plunged on the news that the Food and Drug Administration rejected ImClone's application to sell the experimental cancer drug, Erbitux.
This incident then triggered legal investigations, which also included the case of a US media and domestic design diva, Martha Stewart.
column2: US PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-3" predicative="true" type="COUNTRY"

column1: EU backs stricter nuclear inspections in Iran
column2: Iran PLACE country="IR" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16932748" id="Pl-1" latLong="32.000°N 53.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Foreign ministers of the European Union (EU) said here Monday that they fully supported stricter nuclear inspections of Iran 's nuclear programs by the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA).
column2: Iran PLACE country="IR" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16932748" id="Pl-7" latLong="32.000°N 53.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: A statement issued at the two-day meeting of the EU foreign ministers called on Iran to conclude and implement urgently and unconditionally an additional protocol to the Nuclear Non- Proliferation Treaty allowing for short-notice inspections of suspected nuclear sites in the country.
column2: Iran PLACE country="IR" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16932748" id="Pl-7" latLong="32.000°N 53.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: It said that the EU was seriously concerned about Iran 's nuclear activities and urged it to cooperate fully with the IAEA.
column2: Iran PLACE country="IR" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16932748" id="Pl-7" latLong="32.000°N 53.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: This would be a significant step in demonstrating Iran 's stated peaceful intentions with regard to its nuclear program, the seven-point statement said.
column2: Iran PLACE country="IR" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16932748" id="Pl-7" latLong="32.000°N 53.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: George Papandreou, foreign minister of Greece , the current holder of the EU presidency, said he was in personal contact with IAEA Director-General Mohamed ElBaradei and would follow his lead on this matter.
column2: Greece PLACE country="GR" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:20169939" id="Pl-9" latLong="39.000°N 22.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: EU foreign ministers reiterated that improved trade links with Iran should be conditional on Iran 's cooperation.
column2: Iran PLACE country="IR" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:16932748" id="Pl-7" latLong="32.000°N 53.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: They also said that the EU was closely following the nuclear issue and would revert it to the forthcoming debate of the IAEA meeting on Tuesday.
China  to build nuclear-powered desalinator project
column2: China PLACE country="CN" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:18099327" id="Pl-1" latLong="35.000°N 105.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: China late this year will start building a nuclear-powered desalinator project in Yantai City in east China 's Shandong Province , with a designed capacity of producing 52 million tons of fresh water a year.
column2: Yantai PLACE country="CN" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:18064135" id="Pl-6" latLong="37.533°N 121.400°E" state="37" type="PPL",Shandong PLACE country="CN" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:18075644" id="Pl-9" latLong="36.000°N 119.000°E" state="37" type="CIVIL",Shandong Province PLACE country="CN" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:18075644" id="Pl-7" latLong="36.000°N 119.000°E" state="37" type="CIVIL",Yantai City PLACE country="CN" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:18064135" id="Pl-5" latLong="37.533°N 121.400°E" state="37" type="PPL",China PLACE country="CN" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:18099327" id="Pl-3" latLong="35.000°N 105.000°E" mod="E" type="COUNTRY",city PLACE country="CN" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:18064135" id="Pl-12" latLong="37.533°N 121.400°E" state="37" type="PPL"

column1: Officials with the Development Planning Commission of the Shandong provincial government said the project, to be built in cooperation with Qinghua University, would alleviate water shortages in the city and other parts of the Shandong Peninsula .
column2: Shandong PLACE country="CN" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:18075644" id="Pl-9" latLong="36.000°N 119.000°E" state="37" type="CIVIL",Qinghua PLACE country="CN" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:26002097" id="Pl-13" latLong="36.682°N 114.291°E" state="11" type="PPL",Shandong Peninsula PLACE country="CN" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:18075644" id="Pl-10" latLong="36.000°N 119.000°E" state="37" type="CIVIL",city PLACE country="CN" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:18064135" id="Pl-12" latLong="37.533°N 121.400°E" state="37" type="PPL"

column1: Yantai and other parts of Shandong suffered acute water shortages due to droughts in recent years, changing climate and other reasons.
column2: Yantai PLACE country="CN" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:18064135" id="Pl-6" latLong="37.533°N 121.400°E" state="37" type="PPL",Shandong PLACE country="CN" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:18075644" id="Pl-9" latLong="36.000°N 119.000°E" state="37" type="CIVIL"

column1: Approved by the State Development and Reform Commission, the project is expected to cost 1.6 billion yuan (nearly 200 million US dollars).
column2: US PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-15" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Zhang Zuoyi, director of the Nuclear Energy Technology and Design Institute attached to Qinghua University, was quoted in Monday's Beijing Evening News as saying the fresh water to be produced from the project will cost 3.75 yuan per ton, much less than the cost of water from existing sources.
column2: Qinghua PLACE country="CN" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:26002097" id="Pl-13" latLong="36.682°N 114.291°E" state="11" type="PPL",Beijing PLACE country="CN" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:18101459" id="Pl-14" latLong="39.929°N 116.388°E" state="11" type="PPLC"

column1: The project is expected to use a 200-megawatt nuclear-powered reactor designed by the institute, according to the paper.
The project would be completed and operational in 2007, it said.
US  donates money for Panama  's security forces
column2: Panama PLACE country="PA" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19831979" id="Pl-9" latLong="9.000°N 80.000°W" type="COUNTRY",US PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-1" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Panama is set to receive a donation of more than 7 million US dollars from the United States for the reinforcement of its security forces, local press reported Friday.
column2: United States PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-7" type="COUNTRY",Panama PLACE country="PA" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19831979" id="Pl-13" latLong="9.000°N 80.000°W" type="COUNTRY",US PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-4" type="COUNTRY"

column1: The US embassy in Panama handed over this week to the National Police 11 armored personnel vehicles, which could be used to transport security forces to reinforce security on the border with Colombia .
column2: Panama PLACE country="PA" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19831979" id="Pl-13" latLong="9.000°N 80.000°W" type="COUNTRY",US PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-4" type="COUNTRY",Colombia PLACE country="CO" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19418914" id="Pl-15" latLong="4.000°N 72.000°W" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Panamanian ambassador to Washington Roberto Alfaron said the donation, which has been approved by the US Congress, is a new step in the development of close relations between the two countries.
column2: Panama PLACE country="PA" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19831979" id="Pl-13" latLong="9.000°N 80.000°W" type="COUNTRY",US PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-4" type="COUNTRY",Washington PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:532871" id="Pl-16" latLong="38.895°N 77.037°W" state="DC" type="PPLC",Panamanian PLACE country="PA" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19831979" id="Pl-12" latLong="9.000°N 80.000°W" type="COUNTRY"

column1: He said Panama is in a privileged position in relations with the United States after the signing of a bilateral agreement granting Americans immunity from the International Criminal Court (ICC).
column2: United States PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-7" type="COUNTRY",Panama PLACE country="PA" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:19831979" id="Pl-13" latLong="9.000°N 80.000°W" type="COUNTRY"

column1: On July 1, the United States suspended more than 47 million dollars in military aid to 35 countries for their failure or refusal to sign similar deals.
column2: United States PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-7" type="COUNTRY"

column1: Non-communist party opens website
The China Association for Promoting Democracy (CAPD), one of the eight non-communist parties in the country , has opened its own website, www.mj.org.cn, to help publicize the organization.
column2: China PLACE country="CN" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:18099327" id="Pl-3" latLong="35.000°N 105.000°E" type="COUNTRY",country PLACE country="CN" form="NOM" gazref="IGDB:18099327" id="Pl-4" latLong="35.000°N 105.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: The CAPD is headed by Xu Jialu, who is also vice-chairman of the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress.
The website serves as a new way to publicize the patriotic united front and multi-party cooperation led by the ruling Communist Party of China , said Zhang Huaixi, a vice-chairman of the CAPD.
column2: China PLACE country="CN" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:18099327" id="Pl-3" latLong="35.000°N 105.000°E" type="COUNTRY"

column1: The website is an information platform and database about the association, as well as a new exchange network among its subsidiary organs and all members, according to Zhang.
US  nominee for Navy secretary dies
column2: US PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:840" id="Pl-2" type="COUNTRY"

column1: The Pentagon announced Thursday that Colin R. McMillan, who was nominated by President George W. Bush to be Navy secretary, has died.
A Pentagon spokesman confirmed the death of McMillan, an oilman from New Mexico State , but did not give details of when or where he died.
column2: New Mexico PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:898535" id="Pl-5" latLong="34.500°N 106.000°W" state="NM" type="CIVIL",New Mexico State PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:898535" id="Pl-3" latLong="34.500°N 106.000°W" state="NM" type="CIVIL"

column1: Bush submitted McMillan's nomination to the Senate for approval in May.
McMillan was expected to replace Gordon England, who left the position of Navy secretary to become deputy secretary of the new Homeland Security Department.
McMillan, 67, was chairman of Bush's New Mexico presidential campaign in 2000.
column2: New Mexico PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:898535" id="Pl-5" latLong="34.500°N 106.000°W" state="NM" type="CIVIL"

column1: He lived in Roswell , New Mexico and ran Permian Exploration Corp.
column2: Roswell PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:895171" id="Pl-6" latLong="33.394°N 104.522°W" state="NM" type="PPL",New Mexico PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:898535" id="Pl-5" latLong="34.500°N 106.000°W" state="NM" type="CIVIL"

column1: McMillan was born in Texas and graduated from the University of North Carolina .
column2: North Carolina PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:1028616" id="Pl-8" latLong="35.501°N 80.001°W" state="NC" type="CIVIL",Texas PLACE country="US" form="NAM" gazref="IGDB:1780801" id="Pl-7" latLong="31.250°N 99.250°W" state="TX" type="CIVIL"

column1: He served in the Marine Corps from 1957 to 1972 and was an assistant defense secretary in the early 1990s when Vice President Dick Cheney was the defense secretary.
